Ingrid, de 31 años de edad, es madres soltera de dos niños menores de edad, los que con sacrificio los ha sacado adelante, es una persona humilde, muy trabajadora, con animos de superacion, se dedica a la actividad comerciante vendiendo mercaderia de ropa, cosmeticos entre otros; de donde obtiene sus ingresos para brindar el pan de cada dia a sus pequeños, ademas cuenta con la ayuda economica del padre de sus hijos, lo cual permite cumplir con sus compromisos de pago fuera de los gastos basicos del hogar.

Ha mejorado su vivienda con creditos, por lo que agradece a Kiva por este apoyo y a la vez  solicita 2do credito para invertir en su pequeño negocio y cubrir con la demanda del mismo, de igual forma esto le permitira crecer en el mercado de la competencia y de esta manera obeter mayores ingresos.  

Su mayor sueño es brindarle lo mejor a sus hijos, que estudien y que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Ingrid is 31 years old.  She is a single mother with two dependent children.  Through a lot of sacrifice, she has managed to get her children ahead in life.

Ingrid is an unassuming and very hard-working person who has a desire to improve herself.  Her business is selling clothes, cosmetics and other products.  It is from these business activities that Ingrid makes the necessary income to provide for her children.  She receives financial help from her children's father which allows her to cover her loan repayments at the same time as covering her basic household expenses.

Ingrid has improved her home through loans and she is grateful to Kiva for this support.  She is currently requesting her second loan to invest in her small business and to cover the demand that she has.  This will allow her to grow in her business, to deal with the competition, and to make more profits. 

Ingrid's biggest dream is to provide her children with the best in life.  She would like them to study and to become good people.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her small business

loans.name: Yadira Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Yadira de 32 años de edad, habita en colonia la union en el Municipio de nueva Guinea, en su finca que le heredo su papa, de 36 mzs con buenas condiciones tecnicas para el manejo del hato ganadero, es una persona muy querida en su comunidad hay buenas referencias personales de ella; es trajabadora, respondable y honesta; doña Yadira realiza las actividades Ganaderas, y cultivos de tuberculos; siendo la unidad de trabajo la principal fuente de ingresos de igual forma recibe ingresos de la venta de productos lacteos.  

Solicita el apoyo de Kiva en su primer  crédito para compra de ternero de desarrollo, con el objetivo de aumentar su inventario ganadero.  

Sueña con darle una mejor presentacion y explotar mas su unidad de trabajo de esta forma obtener mayor ingresos y mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs Yadira, age 32, lives in the La Union development in the Nueva Guinea municipality, on the farm that she inherited from her father. It is 36 mzs [manzanas- approximately 62.64 acres] and has good conditions for maintaining a herd of livestock. Yadira is a very well-liked person and her community has provided good personal references for her. She is hard-working, responsible and honest. Yadira works with livestock and grows tubers. This is her main source of income, but she also makes an income from the sale of dairy products.

She is requesting Kiva's support with her first loan which for the purchase of a calf to raise, with the goal of increasing her livestock inventory.

She dreams of having better stock and making more income, thus improving her living conditions.

loans.use: the purchase of a calf to raise

loans.name: Nhoem's Group

texts.en: Eleven people make up this village bank loan. They live in Tadak Pong village in Takeo province. Each will use her portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family's living situation. This village bank loan is led by Mrs. Nhoem S., who has been selected by the other members. Mrs. Nhoem S. and her husband, Mr. Sim Om, are farmers who own a plot of land where they grow rice for sale. She also sells fruit at her home. Her home needs repairs to make it comfortable to live in. Mrs. Nhoem S. is asking for a loan to add to what she has already saved to fix her house. She is a mother of four children: one is a teacher, one is a farmer, and the youngest is a student.

loans.use: To fix her house.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol D. is from the village of Malipayon, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 35 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Mirasol owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling seafood products, including milkfish and salmon, in the local community. Mirasol has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Mirasol joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mirasol has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Mirasol is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish, such as mackerel and sardines. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Mirasol from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase mackerel and sardines

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
Rosa Emilia de  de 36 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos estudian su primaria y secundaria,Trabaja como docente de primaria en la Escuela Mauricio Cajina desde hace 21 años desempeñandose con gran responsabilidad como docente de Pre escolar ,  es una docente que le gusta su trabajo y se ha destacado por ser bien  responsable y humilde, es bien querida por sus compañeros de trabajo y sus  vecinos; ha ido mejorando sus condiciones de vida con esfuerzo propio y con creditos obtenidos por Afodenic los cuales ha cancelados en tiempo y forma, 

solicita el apoyo de Kiva con Financiamiento para comprar ceramica y ponerle a su casa aumentando su valor comercial y brindandole mejores condiciones a su familia, 

su mayor sueño en la vida es que sus hijos estudien y sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Rosa Emilia, age 36, has three children who are in elementary and high school. She has worked as an elementary school teacher in the Escuela Mauricio Cajina for 21 years. She has a lot of responsibility as a pre-school teacher. She loves her job and is known for being responsible and modest. She is well-liked by her co-workers and neighbours. She has been improving her living conditions through her hard work and through loans from Afodenic, which she has repaid on time.

Rosa is requesting this loan from Kiva to purchase ceramic to put in her home, increasing its commercial value and offering her family better living conditions.

Her greatest dream in life is for her children to study and to be good people.

loans.use: to install ceramic in her home

loans.name: Sarath's Group

texts.en: In Prey Snuol village, Takeo province, fourteen people make up a village bank loan. Each member will use their portion of the loan to support their family's living situation. Mrs. Sarath C. has been selected by the other members as the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow rice for sale. Her husband, Mr. Srung Sroeun, is a motorcycle taxi driver who helps support the family, too. They try to work hard, yet they only earn a small income. She wants to buy a cow for a new income stream, but her current savings is not enough to buy one. She is seeking a loan to add to her savings to buy a cow. She is a mother of two children who are not enrolled in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Phourng

texts.en:
Phourng S., 60, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. S. is a farmer, earning an income of US $1.50 per day. One of her children raises chickens and ducks to sell, earning an income of US $2 per day to help cover the family's expenses.

Each month, the family has to spend US $35 on food and US $75 on other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of US $1,000 to purchase more chickens and ducks for her child to raise for sale. In the future, S. would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and ducks to raise for sale

loans.name: Chhil's Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of fourteen people who live in Prey Snuol village in Takeo province. Mrs. Chhil H. been selected by the other members as the village bank president. Each borrower will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family's living situation. Chhil is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Kan Keb, is a construction worker. She is the mother of three children: one is a construction worker and one is a laborer. The third is a vegetable seller in Phnom Penh city, who needs a new motorbike for transportation to sell vegetable. Mrs. Chhil H. is seeking for a loan to supplement her savings to buy a new motorbike.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is a widow who lives in Isabela, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running three businesses: pig fattening, a general store and a game station. She has one child who is 18 years old. Delia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, and by the sweat of her brow, Delia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty Her previous loan of 19,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of 10,000 PHP, improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing 20,000 PHP, which she intends to use to pay for her business operations so that she can continue to save up for a water dispenser, home appliances and a tricycle. Delia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund business operations

loans.name: Poeng's Group

texts.en:
In Prey SnuO. village in Takeo province, there are twelve people joining together for a bank loan. Mrs. Poeng S. has been selected by the other members to be the leader.  They will use their portions of the loan for different purposes in order to improve their families'  living. 
Poeng S. is a pig breeder who  earns money to support her famiL. while her husband, Mr. Sim Thean, is a laborer and basket maker.  Since her business is going well,  Poeng S. wants to expand.  She is asking for a loan to buy more piglets, and also for rice for eating. She is a mother of a child who is attending the local public schoO..

loans.use: To buy more piglets, and to buy rice for eating.

loans.name: Nhoem's Group

texts.en:
Ten people, who make up a village bank loan in Prey Snuol village in Takeo province, have selected Mrs. Nhoem S. M. to become the village bank president. They will use their portions of the loan in varied ways to support their family living.
Mrs. Nhoem S. M. is a pig breeder and a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family.  It is now the time for growing rice, so she needs some money for cultivation.  Mrs. Nhoem S. M. is applying for a loan for farming during the current year. Her husband, Mr. Kusorl Tuy, is a trailer (taxi driver). They have three children, two of whom are studying in the local public school.   The youngest one is a 2 year-old.

loans.use: To cultivate rice for this year.

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en: Felicisima is a widow who lives in Isabela, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running a sari-sari (general store) and selling chicken. She has seven children who are between 30 and 43 years old – six of them have families and one is still single and working. Felicisima joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, and by the sweat of her brow, Felicisima has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty Her previous loan of 17,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of 10,000 PHP, improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her 15th loan, she is borrowing 17,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase more stock so that she can continue to save up for home appliances and home repairs. Felicisima is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Att's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of fourteen people who live in Krang Pou village in Takeo province. Mr. Att S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members.  They will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family living. 
Mr. Att S. is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land where he can grow rice to sell to support his family.  His wife, Mrs. Channa Toeur, is a vegetable seller at the local market where she can earn some money to support the family.  They need a new motorbike, but the money Att S. has saved is not enough  to buy one.  He is asking for a loan to buy a new motorbike. He is a father of three children, two of whom are attending the local public school.  The youngest one is a year old.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida B. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 45 years old, married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Zenaida plants and harvests rice for sale. Zenaida has been farming for 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

Zenaida joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: San

texts.en: San V., 48, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Siem Reap province, Cambodia – an area known for angkorean temples. San sells groceries. Her husband is a farmer, earning $1 US per day to help cover the family's expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $41 US on food and $50 US on other expenses. V. is requesting a loan of $800 US to fix up her grocery store. In the future, she would like to use additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To fix up a grocery store

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
In Krang Poou village in Takeo province, Mrs. C. S. has been selected as the village bank president by the twelve members who will use their portion of the loan in varied ways to support their famiL. living. 
Mrs. C. S. owns a general store in the local village where she earns some money to support her famiL..  Her husband, Mr. Van Prak, is a farmer who owns a 2.6-hectare plot of land for growing rice to sell to support the famiL.. It is now time to grow rice. To improve their rice production, Mrs. C. S. is seeking a loan for this current year. 
In the picture, there are thirteen people because Mrs. Sophea CH., who is a group guaranty, is also among the village bank members.

loans.use: To cultivate rice this year.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en: Diosdada T.'s main source of income comes from running a tricycle transport service. She is 43 years old, married and has four grown-up children. They are from the village of Canibungan Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Diosdada has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2004, Diosdada joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Diosdada is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to repair her vehicle for better service. This will be her 14th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her vehicle for better service

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en: Lanie J. owns and operates a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste in her community. She also makes and sells viand foods like fried fish, chicken and pancit bihon [fried rice noodles]. She is 48 years old, married and has three school-aged children. They are from the village of Macapari, Damulog, Bukidnon. Lanie has been in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Lanie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Lanie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Lanie is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, instant noodles and detergents. This will be her fifth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, instant noodles and detergents

loans.name: Kim Hong's Group

texts.en:
In Krang Pou village in Takeo province, there are eleven people who make up this village bank loan. They will use their portion of the loan in varied ways to improve their family living. 
Mrs. Kim Hong H. has been selected as the village bank president by the other members. She is a meat seller at the local market where she is able to earn some profits to support her family.  Her husband, Mr. Chim Lay, is a trailer (taxi driver) who is also able to earn some money to support his family. At the present, her husband’s taxi is too old to use.  Mrs. Kim Hong H. is asking for a loan to add to her savings in order to buy a new taxi. 
Mrs. Kim Hong H. is a mother of four children, three of whom are attending local public school.   The youngest one is a 4 year-old.

loans.use: To buy a new trailer (taxi )

loans.name: Tunh

texts.en: Tunh W., 35, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for angkorean temples. W. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 80 on the other necessary expenses. W. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase buffaloes to help plow the rice fields. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her third loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy buffaloes to help plow the rice fields

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma C.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She also runs a retailing store selling snack foods and canned goods. She is 49 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the village of Talahiron, Kibawe, Bukidnon. Emma has been in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to expand her business. Emma is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fertilizers and for additional capital. This will be her fourth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fertilizers and for additional capital

loans.name: Saor's Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of 15 people who live in Chreae village in Takeo province. Mrs. Saor K. is the village bank president. She has been selected by the other members who will use their portion of the loan in various ways to improve their family to be living better than now. She owns a general store in the local village where she can sell some groceries to earn some money to support her family. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand. So Mrs. Saor K. is asking for a loan to buy more groceries. Her husband, Mr. Chhoeun Morm, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family. He is a bicycle repairer too. Through these activities, they support seven children. Five of the children are students and the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Tea

texts.en: Tea K., 32, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for angkorean temples. K. raises pigs, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband is a carpenter, earning an income of USD 6 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month the family has to spend USD 60 on food and USD 100 on the other necessary expenses. K. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more pigs to raise for sale. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner. K. appears in the photograph while she is preparing pig food.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to raise

loans.name: Am's Group

texts.en: In Chreae village, Takeo province, twelve people have made up a village bank loan, each planning to use their portion of the loan to improve their family living. Mrs. Am P. is a village bank president who has been selected by the other members. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice to sell to support her family. She currently has some problems with growing rice in her rice field. Therefore, to improve production, Mrs. Am P. is applying for a loan to buy rice seed. With the rest of the loan, she plans to buy piglets and chickens to start a new breeding business. Her husband, Mr. Rim U., is a construction worker. The couple support four children, all of whom are attending the local public school and helping with their parents’ businesses.

loans.use: To purchase rice seed and piglets and chickens for breeding.

loans.name: Alben

texts.en:
Alben R. is from the village of Sampagar, Damulog, Bukidnon. He is 27 years old. Alben is separated from his spouse and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Alben owns & operates a business buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods & toothpaste in the local community. He is also buying and selling vegetables like squash, eggplants & string beans. Alben has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Alben joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alben has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Alben is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like junk foods & canned goods for his newly established retail store. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Alben from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sart

texts.en: Sart T., 23, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for angkorean temples. T. sells groceries, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband is a designer, earning an income of USD 6 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month the family has to spend USD 40 on food and USD 35 on the other necessary expenses. T. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner. T. appears in the photograph while she is cooking.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes U. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 65 years old. Lourdes is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Lourdes owns & operates a business operating tricycle transport services. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Lourdes joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Lourdes from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Having attained a secondary education, Rhodora A., 45, wants to achieve more in life, not just for herself but for her family as well. Rhodora lives in Baseco Port Area, Manila with her husband, Antonio A., who is a photographer. They have six children, three of whom are already working, two are in elementary and one is still toddling at home.

Rhodora presently owns and manages a food stall while overseeing their tricycle operation. Rhodora caters mainly to people near their residence in Baseco. Most of her customers are people who used to wake up early in the morning for work or studies who do not have enough time to cook for themselves and still others are tricycle operators and drivers who just parked their units in front of her store while waiting for passengers. Rhodora and Antonio gather a net income of PHP 10,000 monthly, which they use to meet the needs of the entire family.

To help her continue operation of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 22,000 loan. Rhodora plans to use this loan to further her food vending business and to finally install their own electrical power supply.  Basically, the loan will serve as additional capital that will enable Rhodora to make her business more profitable and lead to more savings.

At present, Rhodora experiences complaints from her customers about the quantity of her food serving because she just adjusted it due to increasing prices of the raw ingredients she uses at present.  She is determined not to be swayed by these struggles, explains to them these adjustments and aims to make her business grow.  Rhodora dreams of seeing her children finish their studies and be used as one family for the glory of the Lord whom they serve.  As a CCT community partner, Rhodora attends faithfully to their weekly fellowship* meeting where she can draw inspiration and strength from the Word of God she received.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy rice, meats, vegetables and other raw ingredients and to pay for the installation of electrical power supply

loans.name: Elena

Elena has been in her business for over one year and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Elena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Elena is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods. This will be her third loan from HSPFI. loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita is married and lives in Isabela, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by a general store and an electronic re-loading business. Her husband Jaime B., who is 68 years old, is a retired employee. She has five children who are between 35 and 40 years old. Four of them have families and one is working to help her. Sherlita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Sherlita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing PHP 17,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell to save up for home appliances and home repair. Sherlita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. loans.name: Crescencia

texts.en:
71-year-old Crescencia is a married woman from the town of Trinidad. She owns and manages a sari-sari store where she sells snacks and other kinds of products. She also makes vinegar out of coconuts and sells them at her store. Aside from that, she also grows pigs and chickens in her backyard. Crescencia does her best to help provide for her family.

Crescencia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Crescencia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Crescencia is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase piglets and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and additional merchandise to sell

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Cerina

texts.en:
Cerina D. G. is from the village of Kimanait, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 53 years old. Cerina is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Cerina owns & operates a business providing general alteration & tailoring services like office, sports & school uniforms to local community members. loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca, 70 years old, is from the town of Trinidad. She has seven children. 

To make a living, Francisca owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Francisca also sells herbal products at her store. 

Francisca joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Francisca is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She is hopeful that this loan will help further improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ma. Cristy

texts.en:
Ma. Cristy D. is from the village of Kimanait, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 45 years old. She is married and has two school-aged children. 

To make a living, Ma. Cristy owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling seafood products, including fish, mackerel, and milk fish in the local community. Ma. Cristy has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ma. Cristy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Ma. Cristy is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell, such as sardines, milk fish, and mackerel. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Ma. Cristy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Ma. Bona

texts.en:
Ma. Bona B. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 39 years old. She is married and has two children aged 13 and 12. To make a living, Ma. Bona owns and operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from gathering and selling seaweeds to the market. 

Ma. Bona joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Bona is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to buy seaweed seedlings and other materials. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To buy seaweed seedlings and other materials

loans.name: Ouch

texts.en: Ouch S., 50, is widowed and resides with her four children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. S. sells food, earning an income of USD 8 per day. Her three children are employed, earning an income of USD 4 each per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 75 on food and USD 65 on the other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a motorbike for the family to use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family to use

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is 53 years old, married, and supports her family by operating three business ventures: raising pigs, operating a tricycle, and selling drinking water. She lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard at her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10000. Rhoda is borrowing PHP 29500 so that she can expand operations. This will be her 18th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 29500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Rhoda aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "dungganon"--a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: Expand business operations

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Soy

texts.en: Soy E., 54, is married and resides with her two children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. E. is a farmer, earning USD 2 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 75 on food and USD 10 on the other necessary expenses. E. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase horses to resell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy horses to resell

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Forty-eight-year-old Manuela is from the town of Trinidad. She is married and has a 22-year-old child. Her husband is a carpenter. Manuela owns and manages a sari-sari store. She sells milk, soft drinks, and other products. Manuela also grows pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them to her community. Manuela wishes to be debt-free someday.

Manuela joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: To make improvements to her house

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en: Nhem S., 35, is married and resides with her two children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia- an area known for rubber plantations. S. is a farmer, earning an income of 2 USD per day. Her husband is a goldsmith, earning an income of 2.50 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend 49 USD on food and 10 USD on other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to purchase pig feed and pigs to raise for sale. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner. S. appears in the photograph with her husband.

loans.use: buy pig feed and pigs to raise for sale

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Having attained an elementary education, Beverly S., 37, wants to achieve more in life- not just for herself but for her family as well. Beverly lives in the Baseco Port Area, Manila, with her husband Reynaldo S., who is a warehouseman. They have three children, who are all in elementary grades at this time.

Beverly presently owns a sari-sari (variety) store and a direct-selling business which caters mainly to people near their residence in the Baseco Port Area, Manila. Her variety store and direct sale of beauty products and other items depends largely on Beverly's perseverance and social connections. She basically offers customers of her store groceries, eggs, condiments, rice, and household detergents, among other items. She offers branded apparel, cosmetics, footwear, and accessories for her direct selling business.  Beverly buys these items in bulk quantities and sells them piecemeal with minimum mark up. Beverly and Reynaldo gather a net income of PHP 10,000 monthly, which they use to meet the daily needs of the entire family including the studies of their children.

To help her continue operation of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 20,000 loan. She plans to use this loan to purchase additional stock for her variety store, and to purchase those items ordered in advance by her customers from her direct selling business. Basically, the loan will serve as additional capital that will enable Beverly to make her business more profitable and lead to more savings.

Beverly dreams of having her own house and lot for her family and sending all her children to school until college.  She looks forward to the growth of her business to sustain their living.  As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends to their weekly fellowship* meeting, from which she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: additional stocks for her variety store and direct selling business

loans.name: Hilario

texts.en:
Hilario A. is from the town of Trinidad. He is 39 years old. Hilario is married and has 2 children aged 13 and 10. To make a living, Hilario owns and operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from gathering and selling seaweed to the market. 

Hilario joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Hilario has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Hilario is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase an engine for his fishing boat. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to pay the tuition fees of his children.

loans.use: to purchase an engine for his fishing boat

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: Ana Gloria F. D. B. D. 51 años D. edad, es una persona soltera, quien vive junto a su hija y una nieta, con quienes resiD. en Ilopango, en el departamento D. San Salvador. DesD. hace 30 años atrás que Ana se dedica al oficio D. corte y confección, tiempo en el cual ha ido adquiriendo mucha experiencia como también clientes fijos. Ella es una persona muy responsable, quien trabaja con mucho esmero por dar lo mejor D. sí. Ana solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir en su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad D. materia prima como: telas, botones, hilos, y agujas, D. forma que siempre pueda elaborar su trabajo con toda la calidad que la identifica. Salir adelante con las ganancias D. este negocio es fundamental para su sustento, ya que es la única fuente D. ingresos con que cuenta para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Ana Gloria F. D. B. is 51 years old.  She is single and lives together with her daughter and granddaughter in Ilopango, in San Salvador department.

Ana has been in the dressmaking business for 30 years.  Over the years she has acquired a lot of experience and also regular customers.  She is a very responsible person who works with a lot of care to do the best work she can.

Ana is requesting this loan so that she can invest in her business, buying a larger quantity of raw materials such as fabric, buttons, threads and needles.  She would like to make this investment so that she continue doing the high-quality work for which she is known.  The profits from Ana's business are essential to her as she uses them to support herself.  This is the only source of income that she has and it helps her to get ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread and needles to improve her business

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en: Chhay S. is married, with one child living at home, in the Kampong Cham province. She works in a grocery store, typically making US $8 each day. Her husband makes rice wine and raises pigs. Her husband, Kong Heng, typically makes about US $2 each day. Chhay S. would like a loan of US $500 to expand her current grocery store.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store.

loans.name: Donny Humberto

texts.es: Donny Humberto M. R. de 27  años de edad, reside en Sacacoyo, en el departamento de La Libertad, en donde vive junto a su esposa. Para ganarse la vida, Donny posee un negocio de venta de comida a la vista, en donde trabaja junto a su esposa, elaborando desayunos y almuerzos, los cuales posteriormente comercializa en su casa de habitación, en donde muchas personas que laboral en los alrededores, consumen sus alimentos. Donny deseando aumentar sus ventas y mejorar su economía, solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de verduras, legumbres, granos básicos, entre otros más para poder ampliar su menú y así tener a sus clientes satisfechos de manera que siempre quieran regresar a comer a este lugar.
texts.en:
Donny Humberto M. R. is 27 years old and lives together with his wife in Sacacoyo, in La Libertad department.

Donny earns a living through his business selling buffet food.  He works with his wife, preparing breakfasts and lunches which he then sells from his home where many people who work in the surrounding area come to eat their food.  Donny would like to increase his sales and improve his finances.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can buy a larger quantity of greens, vegetables, basic grains and other products.  This will enable him to expand his menu and thereby satisfy his customers so that they always want to return to his business to eat.

loans.use: To buy staple food products that he needs to make lunches

loans.name: Melly

texts.en:
Melly is a married woman who lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: a pig fattening and a food vending business. Her husband Saol H., who is 56 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 5 children who are between 15 and 32 years old. Melly joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 6 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Melly has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,800, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 7th loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use to pay for more funds in business operations so that she can continue to save up for family needs and her children’s education. Melly is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon- a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Capital for pig fattening and food vending businesses.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta, 42 years old, is a married woman from the town of Trinidad. She has no children and prays to have her own someday. Julieta owns a sari-sari store. She sells shampoo, soy sauce and other various products. Her husband operates a "habal-habal" (motorcycle) transport service.

Julieta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell and for motorcycle repair. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve her business.

loans.use: Stock for sari-sari store and motorcycle repair.

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en: Chhay S., 36, is married and lives with four of her children in the Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who typically makes about US $1 each day, and she is supported by her husband who works at a rubber plantation. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have resulted in a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Chhay S. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US $400 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy basic household products to sell

loans.name: Leticia's Group

texts.en:
Leticia F. is from the village of Marcos, Roxas, Isabela. She is 57 years old. Leticia is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Leticia F.'s Group.

Leticia is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Leticia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Leticia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Leticia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Leticia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Leticia is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Leticia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Krouch

texts.en: Krouch S., 47, is married and resides with her four children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. S. sells fruit, earning an income of USD 10 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 83 on food and USD 60 on their other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more fruit to sell. In the future, she would like to use their additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: Buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Nicolás

texts.es: Nicolás M. es una persona muy responsable y emprendedora, quien a sus 65 años de edad,  trabaja muy duro para poder sostener su hogar. Él reside en San Marcos, municipio el cual se encuentra  en el departamento de San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos. Nicolás se dedica a la elaboración de quesadillas, las cuales son un tipo de pan hecho de harina de arroz, queso, crema, entre otros ingredientes más, y es un platillo muy tradicional de este país. Él  elabora las quesadillas junto a su esposa y posteriormente sale a venderlas de forma ambulante, y así mismo realiza pequeños pedidos para tiendas que compran cantidades un poco grandes. Nicolás, solicita un préstamo por medio del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para invertir en la materia prima de las quesadillas y de esta forma elaborar mayor cantidad y de esta forma aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Nicolás M. is a very responsible entrepeneur who, at 65 years of age, works hard to provide and income for his family.  He lives with his wife and two children in San Marcos which is in the department of San Salvador.  

Nicolás makes "quesadillas", a typical dish in this country which is a type of bread made with rice flour, cheese, cream and other ingredients.  He and his wife make and sell them in the streets and also take small orders from stores who buy larger quantities.

Nicolás plans to use the loan to buy ingredients so he can make more quesadillas and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy rice meal, cheese and cream to make "quesadillas"

location.town: San Marcos, departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Charie

texts.en:
Charie is 30 years old and supports her family by operating a business venture buying and selling eggs. She lives in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu City. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard buying and selling eggs, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 31,800. Charie is borrowing PHP 9,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 6th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 7,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Charie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon- a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase eggs to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es: Dolores L. M. de 41 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Arce, en el departamento de La Libertad, ella es madre soltera, quien vive junto a sus cuatro hijos de: 18, 16, 9 y 7 años de edad, quienes dependen por completo de ella. Como toda madre responsable, quien ha debido trabajar muy duro realizando tanto el papel de padre como madre, se dedica a la venta de ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, la cual comercializa en su casa, Dolores vende la ropa a muy buenos precios, así mismo es una persona muy amable y positiva, razón por la que cuenta con varios clientes. Ella solicita un préstamo con el deseo de poder contar con el monto necesario para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir, con lo que espera obtener mayores ganancias, las cuales sean de gran beneficio para sus hijos como también para su hogar.
texts.en:
Dolores L. M. is 41 years old and lives in Ciudad Arce in the department of La Libertad.  She is a single mother and the sole income earner for her four children, ages 18, 16, 9 and 7.  She is a responsible person who has worked hard as both father and mother to her children.  She sells men's, women's and children's clothing out of her home.

Dolores offers her products at low prices.  She is always kind and positive and therefore has many customers.  She plans to use the loan to buy more inventory so she can increase her earnings which will be beneficial to her children and household.

loans.use: To buy clothing for retail sale

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly C., 29, is married with three young children living at home in the Kampong Cham province. She works in a grocery store, typically making US $2.50 each day. Her husband purchases and sells yams at the local market. Her husband, Sari Narin, typically makes about US $10 each day as a yam farmer. Ly C. would like a loan of US $300 to reinvest in her husband's business. (C. is pictured with her family members.)

loans.use: To increase yam farming business

loans.name: Cheam

texts.en: Cheam C., 31, is married and resides with her two children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. C. sells food in front of a garment factory, earning an income of USD 7 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 44 on food and USD 28 on their other necessary expenses. C. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a sugarcane squeezer to improve her food selling business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: Buy a sugarcane squeezer to improve food selling business

loans.name: Rosibel Mercedes

texts.es: Rosibel Mercedes R.  D. H. D. 41 años D. edad, resiD. en  Colón, en el departamento D. La Libertad, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo, quien es empleado D. una empresa privada, y así mismo vive junto a cinco hijos, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Rosibel  posee una venta D. cosméticos, cremas para el cabello y cuerpo, perfumes, lociones, shampoo,  y ropa D. camas. Su negocio está ubicado en su casa D. habitación, y así mismo sale a vender las prendas D. vestir en los municipios D. Colón y San Juan Opico. Ella solicita un préstamo con el deseo D. contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad D. mercadería, aumentando la cantidad D. maquillajes y D. esta forma ofrecer diferentes precios, así mismo comprar cremas para el cuerpo, lo cual es lo que posee mayor cantidad D. demanda. Esto llena D. mucha ilusión ya que espera mejorar sus ganancias, y D. esta forma seguir brindándoles la oportunidad a todos sus hijos D. seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Rosibel Mercedes R. D. H. is 41 years old and lives in Colón in the department of La Libertad.  She lives with her husband, who is an employee of a private company, and their five school-aged children.  

Rosibel sells cosmetics, hair and bodycare products, perfume, lotions and bed linens.  She operates her business out of her home and also sells clothing in the towns of Colón and San Juan Opico.

She is requesting the loan to buy more merchandise, especially to increase her line of cosmetic products so she can lower her prices.  She will also buy body lotions which are in high demand.  She is excited about being able to increase her earnings and thus proviD. a good education for her children.

loans.use: To buy body and haircare products, cosmetics and other items

loans.name: Chhea

texts.en: Chhea E., 51, is a widow who lives with her child in the Kampong Cham province. She sells clothes and fermented fish at the local market and is able to make about US $7 profit every day. Chhea E. is asking for a loan of US $1,000 to purchase more fermented fish to sell.

loans.use: Purchase fermented fish to sell

loans.name: Douglas Ernesto

texts.es: Douglas Ernesto A. P. de 40 años de edad, es un hombre muy responsable con su hogar y un excelente padre de familia, el vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos de: 9 y 1 año de edad. Douglas, trabaja de lunes a domingo, en su propia pupusería, la cual se encuentra a la par de su casa, en donde su esposa se encarga de elaborar las pupusas y Douglas de atender a las personas y entregar los pedidos a sus clientes, así mismo comercializa bebidas frías y calientes. El negocio es bastante estable, y el cual permite que Douglas junto a su familia puedan contar con una vida estable. Él solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de maíz, y harina de arroz, así mismo para comprar: queso, chicharrón y frijoles, de manera que pueda contar con toda la materia prima necesaria para aumentar la cantidad de producción de pupusas, de forma que sus ingresos también se vean incrementados.
texts.en:
Douglas Ernesto A. P. is 40 years old and is a hard-working, responsible father.  He lives with his wife and two children, ages 9 and 1.  Douglas works Monday through Sunday out of his home in his own "pupusería" (selling pupusas - thick corn tortillas).  His wife makes the pupusas and Douglas attends to customers and delivers orders.  He also sells hot and cold beverages.

The business is fairly stable and allows Douglas and his family to have a permanent income.  He plans to use the loan to buy more corn, rice meal, cheese, pork rinds and beans.  This will allow him to increase pupusa production and, therefore, income.

loans.use: To buy corn, beans, cheese and pork rinds

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en: Khiev V., 56, sells clothes making US $30 in revenue each day in the Kampong Cham province. She is married and has one child living at home to support. Her husband, Sam Ol, makes approximately US $1 every day growing rice. Khive V. would like a loan of US $1,000 to purchase a mini truck to transport clothes to sell at another village.

loans.use: To purchase a mini truck

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 22-year old single woman who supports her family by operating a general store. She lives in Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. Josephine joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Josephine has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 6th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for future business expansion. Josephine is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon- a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase general store stock to sell

loans.name: Norma Beatriz

texts.es: Norma Beatriz F. de 33 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Arce, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad, ella vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos de 13 y 4 años de edad, quienes se dedican a estudiar. Norma posee una panadería, la cual desde hace nueve años funciona en su casa, su esposo le ayuda a elaborar el pan, que posteriormente sale a repartir a todos sus clientes, quienes tienen negocios como tiendas y pequeños superes, en donde obtiene pedidos muy grandes. El deseo de Norma es crecer aún más en el negocio, de manera que pueda atender mayor cantidad de clientes, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo, a través del cual pueda comprar harina por mayor, levadura y todos los productos que se utilizan para la elaboración del pan, en cantidades grandes para obtenerla a menores precios. Esto sería de mucho beneficio tanto para su negocio como para su familia quien depende absolutamente de la panadería, ya que esta es la única fuente de ingresos que poseen, razón por la cual se esfuerza día con día para brindar el mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Norma Beatriz F. is 33 years old and she lives in the city of Arce, located in the department of La Libertad. She lives together with her husband and two children, aged 14 and 4.  They are both in school. Norma has a bakery that she has been running from her home over the past nine years. Her husband helps her make bread, which she later distributes to her clients who own convenience stores and small grocery stores. They place large orders. 

Norma's wish is to expand her business even more, to be able to serve larger numbers of clients.  To this end she requests a loan. She will be able to purchase flour in wholesale, yeast and all the other products that they use to make bread in large quantities and to obtain volume discounts.

This will be of great benefit to their business and to her family who depend completely on this bakery. It is the only source of income and it is the reason why she works hard day after day to provide her clients with the best service.

loans.use: To purchase flour and other ingredients for her bakery.

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en: Bayarmaa lives with her husband and four children in the Tuv province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in their own house with a fence. Her husband and oldest son currently work as private businessmen in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter is a university student and her youngest two twin sons both attend a local high school. Bayarmaa operates two kinds of seasonal businesses, a shoe making and a construction business, to support her family. She started her construction business in 2001 and has managed it successfully over the years. Her three sons started to help with her construction business in 2005. She usually operates her construction business during summer months while in winter months she runs her shoe making business, which is very profitable as well. After many years of operation she has gained a lot of experience in both businesses and has built a stable operation in her community with many loyal customers. With her business earnings, she was able to build a 2 floor apartment which hasn't been fully completed yet. In addition, Bayarmaa works as a guard for the local company with a monthly salary of 120,000 MNT to supplement her earnings. She is a clever and hardworking person and is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan in order to increase her working capital for both businesses.

loans.use: To increase her working capital for cobbling and construction

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Pov K. is 20 years old and lives with her young child and her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She is a good housewife, stays at home and cooks for her family members. Her husband works at a rubber plantation, and typically makes US $4 per day. To earn more money, Pov is asking for a loan of US $700 to purchase a plot of land to grow yams. (Pov K. is pictured with her husband and her young child.)

loans.use: To purchase a plot of farmland

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es: María Magdalena R. D. Z. D. 45 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Mejicanos, en donD. resiD. en la casa D. su madre junto a ella, su esposo un hijo y un sobrino, ambos menores D. edad. María posee un negocio en el cual se dedica a la venta D. frijoles, así mismo se dedica a la elaboración y ventas D. pupusas, las cuales comercializa en su casa D. habitación y que así mismo elabora junto a su madre. El esposo D. María se encargar D. entregar los pedidos hechos D. sus clientes, llevándolos hasta la puerta D. sus hogar, con esto María y su familia espera brindar un mejor servicio, gracias al cual pueda contar con más clientes. María solicita un préstamo a Integral, por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. frijoles, así mismo materia prima para la elaboración D. pupusas, ingredientes entre los cuales están: maíz, queso y chicharrón. Este negocio es el único que les permite contar con un sueldo seguro, por lo que es muy importante para María y su familia mejorarlo ya que dependen por completo D. este.
texts.en:
Maria Magdalena Ramirez D. Z. is 45 years old. She lives in the municipality of Mejicanos and she lives with her mother, her husband, their son, and a nephew. The two children are under age. Maria has a business selling beans. She also makes and sells pupusas, which she sells from their home. She makes them with her mother's help. 

Maria's husband delivers the orders that are placed by clients, making the delivery to their door. Maria and her family work to proviD. an improved client service, which has improved their client base. 

Maria requests a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner) in order to purchase larger quantities of beans and the ingredients she needs to make pupusas, including: corn, cheese, and pork meat.  This business is the only steady source of income, which is why it is so important to Maria and her family to improve it. They completely depend on it.

loans.use: To purchase beans.

loans.name: María Ancelma

texts.es: María Ancelma R. D. R. D. 38 años D. edad, es una persona que anhela mucho salir adelante y mejorar día con día en la vida. Ella vive junto a su esposo y una hija D. 10 años D. edad, en el municipio D. Victoria, en el departamento D. Cabañas. María  posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos y D. primera necesidad para el hogar. Este negocio es el cual le ha permitido poder contar con ganancias extras lo que le brinda la ayuda necesaria tanto a su esposo como a ella para pagar su casa a tiempo, y así mismo contar con los alimentos y todo lo necesario para vivir dignamente. Es por esto que María desea contar con más productos en la tienda, razón por la cual solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, lácteos, bebidas y otros más los cuales son necesarios en una buena tienda. Esto es muy importante para María ya que cuenta con mucha competencia en el lugar, es por esto que debe contar con todo lo necesario para satisfacer a sus clientes y así ganar otros más los cuales prefieran comprar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Ancelma R. D. R. is 38 years old. She is a person who works very hard to come out ahead and improve her life day after day. She lives together with her husband and their 10-year old daughter in the municipality of Victoria, in the department of Cabanas.

Maria has a store from where she sells perishable goods and basic needs products for the home.  This business has allowed her to earn an extra income to proviD. her husband with the support he needs to make their house payments on time. They are also able to purchase food and all which they need for a dignified life. 

Maria wants to have a larger inventory of products for her store, and to this end she requests a loan. She will purchase rice, beans, sugar, milk products, soft drinks, and other products which are in most demand for her store. This is very important for Maria because she has to contend with a great deal of competition. She needs to have the inventory that she needs to satisfy her clients, and to attract more customers to her store.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for her store.

loans.name: Cruz María

texts.es: Cruz María I. I., reside en Cantón Agua Zarca, ubicado en Sensuntepeque en el departamento de Cabañas. Ella vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como agricultor, y así mismo vive junto a dos hijos menores de edad, quienes se dedican a estudiar. Cruz  se dedica a la venta de ropa para niños, mujeres y hombres, la cual comercializa en el mercado regional de Sensuntepeque. Cruz  solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar ropa por mayor, en diferentes colores, tallas y estilos, de manera que su venta sea más vistosa para las personas. Todo esto lo hace con el deseo de poder mejorar su venta, ofreciendo mayor cantidad de productos de manera que abarque mayor cantidad de gustos y necesidades. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y es una madre emprendedora muy responsable con sus hijos, quien depende por completo de su trabajo diario y el de su esposo.
texts.en:
Cruz Maria I. I. lives in the community of Agua Zarca, located in Sensuntepeque in the department of Cabanas. She lives together with her husband, an agriculturist, and with their two young children. They are both in school. Cruz sells clothing for kids, ladies, and gentlemen, in the regional market of Sensuntepeque.
