Cruz requests a loan to purchase items of clothing in wholesale, in a variety of colors, sizes and styles, to improve the appeal of her store to clients. 

She does all of this with the goal of improving her sales, offering a wider variety of products to appeal to a broader range of personal styles and needs. She is a very hardworking person and she is en enterprising mother who is very responsible with her children. She depends on her daily work and that of her husband.

loans.use: To purchase articles of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make pupusas.

loans.name: Leydi Abigahil

texts.es: Leydi Abigahil G. D. C. D. 25 años D. edad, es una joven madre D. familia, la cual posee su propio negocio, con el enorme deseo D. contar con una vida mejor. Ella resiD. en Mejicanos, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador, mismo lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos D.: 3 y 1 año D. edad. Leydi posee una librería en la cual se dedica a la venta D. libros, cuadernos, peluches y diferentes tipos D. papelería, el negocio se encuentra en su casa D. habitación lo que es muy bueno para ella ya que pueD. dedicarse a sus hijos, al mismo tiempo que trabaja por una vida mejor. Leydi solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en su negocio, equipándolo D. todo lo necesario para incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Leydi Abigahil Gonzalez D. Carcamo is 25 years old and she is a young mother. She has her own business and she has an enormous wish to have a better life. She lives in the community of Mejicanos, located in the department of San Salvador. She lives together with her husband and their two children, aged 3 and 1. Leydi has a books store from where she sells books, notebooks, stuffed toys, and a variety of office supplies. She has her business set up in her home which is very convenient for her because she can still take care of the kids, all the while working towards a better life. Leydi requests a loan to have the funds she needs to invest in her business. She will supply the business will that entire she needs to improve her earnings.

loans.use: To purchase books and school supplies for resale.

loans.name: Mayra Elizabeth

texts.es: Mayra Elizabeth H. D. V. D. 35 años D. edad, resiD. en San Antonio Abad, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Ella vive junto a su esposo, quien se destaca por ser un hombre muy trabajador, y así también vive junto a su pequeña hija D. cinco años D. edad. Mayra se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. tortillas, las cuales comercializa D. lunes a domingo tanto al mediodía como por las tardes. Este ha sido un negocio D. mucha ayuda tanto para Mayra  como para toda su familia, por lo que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. maíz, D. esta misma forma comprar tambos D. gas propano para poder contar con un pequeño almacenamiento D. este, ya que en ocasiones durante el año el gas escasea lo que es muy perjudicial para su negocio. Mayra es una mujer muy trabajadora, la cual se esfuerza al máximo por su familia.
texts.en:
Mayra Elizabeth Hernandez D. V. is 35 years old and she lives in the community of San   Antonio Abad, located in the department of San Salvador. She lives together with her husband, a very hard working man, and with their little girl who is 5 years old. Mayra makes and sells tortillas. She makes her sales from Monday to Sunday during the mid-day hours and in the evenings. 

This business has been a great help for Mayra and for her entire family. She requests a loan to be able to purchase large quantities of corn and to purchase barrels of propane gas, to have a small supply. During this time of year there is a shortage in propane gas and it is very deleterious to her business. Mayra is a very hardworking woman who gives her all for her family.

loans.use: To purchase corn to make tortillas.

location.town: San Antonio Abad, departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Verónica Inés

texts.es: Verónica Inés A. D. U. D. 37 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador, en donD. vive junto a dos hijos menores D. edad. Verónica es una persona muy trabajadora, quien ha tenido que ser padre y madre para poder sacar adelante a su familia, debido a que ella es madre soltera. Verónica posee una tienda D. productos perecederos y D. primera necesidad, así mismo se dedica a la elaboración D. platillos típicos salvadoreños entre los cuales se encuentra: atol D. elote, yuca frita, papas fritas, elotes asados y otros más. Los platillos típicos los comercializa D. forma ambulante cerca D. uno del monumento más simbólico D. la capital D. El Salvador, el cual es llamado “Salvador del Mundo”. Con todo el deseo D. salir adelante y poder contar con una vida mejor, Verónica solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir su tienda y así mismo elaborar mayor cantidad D. platillos.
texts.en:
Veronica Ines A. D. Umana is 37 years old and she lives in the department of San Salvador.  She lives together with her two young children. Veronica is a very hard working person who has had to be both father and mother to support her family because she is a single mother. 

Veronica has a store from where she sells perishable goods and basic needs products. She also makes traditional Salvadoran foods, among which are: corn drinks, fried yucca, fried potatoes, roasted corn on the cob, and others. She sells these traditional foods itinerantly near one of the new symbolic monuments in the capital city of El Salvador, named "Salvador del Mundo", meaning the Savior of the World. With all her will to come out a head and to have a better life,  Veronica requests a loan to supply her store with inventory and to make larger quantities of  prepared foods.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.es: Imelda V. M. de 57 años de edad, es  una señora muy responsable y dedicada, quien reside en el departamento de San Salvador, en donde vive junto a su madre y dos hijos. Imelda es una madre responsable y muy humilde, la cual debe trabajar muy duro por darle todo lo necesario a su familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de periódicos,  agua embotellada, jugos y sodas, su negocio esta ubicado en la terminal de occidente, en donde es un lugar muy transitado por personas que se dirigen del occidente hacia la capital del país o viceversa. Así mismo cada mediodía, Imelda se encarga de elaborar y comercializar tortillas. Imelda es una señora digna de admirar, por su enorme esfuerzo para sacar adelante a su familia. Ella solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar más diarios, agua, jugos, y así mismo materia prima para elaborar tortillas.
texts.en:
Imelda Vasquez M. is 57 y ears old and she is a very responsible and dedicated woman. She lives in the department of San Salvador, together with her mother and her two children. Imelda is a very responsible and humble mother who must work very hard to provide her family with all that they need. 

She sells newspapers, bottled water, juices, and soft drinks. Her business is located in Terminal Occidente which is very well traveled by individuals who travel to and from the west region of the country. Every lunch hour Imelda also makes tortillas. Imelda is someone worthy of admiration for her great efforts to provide for her family. She requests a loan form Integral (Kiva Field Partner), to have enough funds to purchase newspapers, water, juices, and ingredients she needs to make tortillas.

loans.use: To purchase newspapers for resale and corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Herber Luis

texts.es: Herber Luis M. G. de 25 años de edad, es un joven co muchos deseos de ser mejor en la vida y así mismo brindarle toda la ayuda necesaria a su madre, junto a quien reside en el municipio de Cuscatancingo, así mismo vive junto a un sobrino de 12 años de edad. Herber se dedica a la venta de frutas, carne de pollo y de res, y así mimos comercializa verduras. Esta actividad la realiza de forma ambulante en su pick up, en el cual vende sus productos en Cuscatancingo y ciudad futura, él es muy conocido en la zona y muchas personas esperan a que el llegue a sus colonias para comprar lo que necesiten para su cocina. Herber solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir su venta de frutas y verduras y así mismo para poder comercializar mayor cantidad de carne, de esta forma él espera mejorar sus ganancias lo cual es una de las principales metas que posee.
texts.en:
Herber Luis M. G. is 25 years old and he is a young man with a great desire to have a better life and to provide her mother with the help that she needs. He lives with her and a 12-year old nephew in the municipality of Cuscatancingo. Herber sells fruits, chicken, beef, and vegetables. His business is a traveling business which he operates from his pick up truck. He sells products in Cuscatancingo and in the city of Futura. He is well known in the region and many clients wait for him to arrive in their community to purchase whatever they need for their kitchen.

Herber requests a loan in order to supply his business of fruits and vegetables and to purchase a larger quantity of meat. He expects to increase his earnings, which is one of his primary goals.

loans.use: To purchase fruits, vegetables, and meats for resale.

loans.name: Gertrudis Marilin

texts.es: Gertrudis Marilin H. C. de 25 años de edad, reside en Sensuntepeque, en el departamento de Cabañas, y vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos de 9, 6 y 4 años de edad. El esposo de Gertrudis es publicista, por lo que cuenta con un negocio de elaboración de elaboración de anuncios, trabajo en el cual Gertrudis es su mano derecha, ya que ella se encarga de elaborar gran parte del arte de algunos anuncios y así mismo se encarga de entregarlos. Es como de esta manera Gertrudis junto a su compañero de vida, han salido adelante y han podido brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos. Gertrudis solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de materiales como: pinturas, moldes y otros más para elaborar mayor cantidad de anuncios publicitarios.
texts.en: Gertrudis Marilin H. C. is 25 years old and she lives in Sensuntepeque, in the department of Cabanas. She lives together with her husband and their three children aged, 9, 6, and 4.  Gertrudis' husband works in advertising and he has a business where they make advertisements.   Gertrudis is his right hand woman in the business. She largely takes care of the art work associated with the creation of advertisements and she also is in charge of their delivery. This is how Gertrudis and her life partner have come out ahead and they have been able to provide their children with all that they need. Gertrudis requests a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner) in order to purchase larger quantities of materials such as: paints, patterns, and other materials needed to create advertisements.

loans.use: To purchase paints and patterns to make advertisements.

loans.name: Susana Vanessa

texts.es:
Susana tiene 25 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que es conocida en la región Lambayeque por su producción de limón. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado aproximadamente a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella trabaja como profesora en un centro educativo de la zona y adicionalmente se dedica a elaborar postres para ofrecerlos en venta entre los estudiantes de su escuela y el público en general. El negocio cuenta con buena acogida debido a la calidad con la que los prepara. Ella se vale de los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad para ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante a su familia.

Susana desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más insumos que le permitan ampliar su producción y percibir mayores ganancias por sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Susana is 25 years old, she is married and she lives together with her husband and their children in the Olmos district, an agricultural and commercial region. This region is known in Lambayeque for its lemon production. The region belongs to the province of Lambayeque and it is located approximately two hours from the city of Chiclayo. 

She works as a teacher at a school in the area and she also makes desserts that she sells to students in the school and to the general public. Her business enjoys good patronage thanks to the quality of her products. She values the income that she earns through this business because she is able to help her husband provide for the family. 

Susana wishes to expand her business with the acquisition of more ingredients, permitting her to increase production and improve her sales. In order to meet her objective she has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 700 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to increase production.

loans.name: Medy

texts.en:
Medy P. is from the village of Namillangan Alfonso Lista, Ifugao. She is 34 years old. Medy is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Medy owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Medy has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Medy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Medy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Medy is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Medy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for general store

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah to improve her decorative embroidery business. She started this business part-time 10 years ago to share the financial burden with her husband, but now it has become a full-time job because she receives good number of orders every month which enable her to manage finances smoothly. With the loan, she will buy embroidery material such as beads, colored thread, clothes and sketches in bulk for her business.  

She lives with her husband and 2 daughters in Multan which is a historic city of Pakistan. She owns a two room house there in the area of Samejabad. Her husband is a rickshaw driver and provides transport services to his clients and to school children. Her daughters are both enrolled in school and are getting their education. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she established good credit behavior and never missed any meetings. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady with a raised hand is Nazia”.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material for decorative embroidery business

loans.name: Tito

texts.es:
Tito tiene 41 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a sus padres y hermanos  en el distrito de Las Lomas, que pertenece a la Región Piura, a aproximadamente 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del Departamento de Lambayeque.

Él es agricultor, actualmente siembra maracuyá en un terreno que heredó y que con mucho esfuerzo lo mantiene, ya que los frutos al ser cosechados son vendidos en el mercado de su zona.  Por ser frutos de gran calidad, tiene mucha acogida entre sus vecinos y comerciantes que llegan a la zona.  El dinero que percibe de estas ventas lo utiliza para el apoyo de su familia. 

Tito desea adquirir más insumos para cultivar la tierra y obtener mejores frutos para su venta, de esta manera percibir mayores ganancias. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Tito is 41 years old, he is single and he lives with his parents and siblings in the district of Las Lomas in the region of Piura. It is located approximately 4 hours from the cit of Chiclayo, the capital city of the department of Lambayeque. 

He is an agriculturist who harvests passion fruits on a plot of land he inherited. He maintains the plantation with a great deal of work. The fruit he harvests are sold in the market in his community. His fruit harvests are of excellent quality which is why he enjoys such good patronage from this neighbors and merchants of the region. The income he earns from his sales is used to support his family. 

Tito wishes to purchase more materials he needs to cultivate the land and to improve his harvest and see improved earnings. He has requested a loan of Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles in order to meet his objective.

loans.use: To purchase products to cultivate his land.

loans.name: María Amelia

texts.es:
María tiene 41 años de edad, es conviviente y reside junto a su familia en Tambogrande, que pertenece a la región Piura, a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del Departamento de Lambayeque.

Ella tiene una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio, donde atiende de manera muy amable a sus clientes, los que a la fecha ya están fidelizados. Asimismo, María en su afán de salir adelante, vende productos cosméticos, los que obtiene de un proveedor.  También con la ayuda de su esposo cría ganado porcino y ovino, los que engorda y una vez ya desarrollados los vende a sus vecinos y comerciantes que llegan a la zona donde vive. 

María desea adquirir más alimento para engordar a su ganado, luego venderlos y obtener mayores ingresos para ayudar a su familia. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1700 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Maria is 41 years old and she lives together with her husband and family in Tambogrande, in the region of Piura. It is located 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the department of Lambayeque. 

She has a small store installed in her home. She is able to tend to her customers in a very kind manner, all of whom have remained steady clients. Maria's goal is to come out ahead. She sells cosmetics which she acquires from a distributor. And with the help of her husband she also raises pigs and sheep. She fattens them and once they have developed she sells them to her neighbors and to the merchants who visit the region where they live. 

Maria wishes to acquire more feed to fatten her livestock, to sell and to obtain improve earnings for her family. She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1700 nuevos soles in order to meet her objective.

loans.use: To purchase balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina lives in Multan, which is a big city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan. She lives here in the area of Samejabad with her family in a 2 room brick house. She came here 6 years ago with her family.
 
She is 34 years old, married to M. R., and has 6 children. Her elder son works in a hotel for a low income while the others stay at home and don’t do anything. Zarina couldn’t provide them education facilities due to financial constraints.
 
Her husband also works in a Punjabi food hotel. His income is not very satisfactory, and that’s why Zarina helps her family financially by operating an embroidery business. She started this business a few years ago. In Multan, this is a very common and demanding business because people from other cities come to buy embroidered dresses and other clothes from here due to their cheap rates and good quality. She collects orders from her neighborhood clients and finishes the orders on time to earn an income. She is very good at it and wants to expand her business on larger scale.  

That’s why she has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah. With the loan, she will buy embroidery material in bulk such as clothes, beads, colored thread and sketches which help her to make the embroidered dresses in good quantity and in contact with different cloth shops and boutiques. 

She hopes that it will bring positive results for her business. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she established good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.  

Note: “In the photo, the lady with a raised hand is Zarina”.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material for embroidery business

loans.name: Kholmat

texts.ru: Караев Холмат проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст, 57 лет. Женат. Отец двоих детей. Образование средне - специальное, шафер. Он предоставляет услугу, то есть занимается перевозкой людей. В основном он развозит людей по маршруту Рудаки-Душанбе. В этой области уже 10 лет. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины, чтобы предоставить безопасную услугу.
texts.en: Kholmat K. lives in the Rudaki Region. Age: 57. Married, with two children. Secondary technical education. He is a driver. He provides transportation services, that is  arrying passengers. His usual route is between Rudaki and Dushanbe. He has been in this business for over 10 years. He is taking a loan in order to repair his car and be able to provide safe transportation.

loans.use: Auto repair

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea V., 47, is married and resides with her four children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. V. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 65 on other necessary expenses. V. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a plot of farmland to improve the farming business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy a plot of farmland to improve farming business

loans.name: Suhbaatar

texts.en:
Suhbaatar is 49 years old and lives with his wife in a house with fence in Songino-Hairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia’s capital city. His wife currently operates a clothing making and repairing business. 

Suhbaatar supports his entire family by driving a taxi using his own car. He started his own transportation business in 2007 based on his many years of experience working in the transportation field. 

For the future, he wants to start another business dealing in fast food. Suhbaatar is a modest and honest person and says, "I plan to continue operating my current business so that I can start my new business." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to use for his new fast food business.

loans.use: To use for his new fast food business

loans.name: Sourng

texts.en:
Sourng C., 63, is married and resides with his three children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. C. sells palm products, earning an income of USD 4 per day. His wife is a farmer, earning an income of USD 2 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 80 on food and USD 30 on the other necessary expenses. 

C. is requesting a loan of USD 1050 to purchase a plot of farmland to improve the farming business. In the future, he would like to use the additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy a plot of farmland to improve farming business

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
Phorn L., 31, is married and resides with her two children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. L. is employed at a factory, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 13 on the other necessary expenses. 

L. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for family use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Bashiran's Group

texts.en:
Bashiran is a resident of Multan which is famous for its tombs and history. She lives here in the area of Samejabad in a 2-room brick house with her family. She came here 15 years ago. She is involved in a decorative embroidery business. She collects order from her neighborhood clients to financially support her family.  

She is married to M. H. who is a daily wage laborer. She has given birth to three sons and a daughter. Her eldest son has a business selling cosmetics while her second son operates a business selling bed-sheets. Her daughter is a school teacher and has a graduate degree. 

Bashiran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her eldest son’s business selling cosmetics. With the loan, he will purchase cosmetics such as eye shadow, mascara, liner, lipstick etc in good quantity to sell through his shop. He has been doing this business for over 5 years and Bashiran is hopeful that an investment will improve his business further. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has paid her installments on time and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Bashiran.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Zorig

texts.en:
Zorig is 39 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, in Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia. His three children attend a local secondary school. His wife and Zorig operate a grocery shop within their own fence. His wife is responsible for managing their grocery shop while he runs a carpentry business out of his home where he produces a variety of wooden items according to his customers' orders to supplement his earnings. 

Zorig started his own business in 2004 by operating a coal and firewood trading business with working capital of 200,000 MNT. After years of successful operation, he was able to build his own grocery stop which opened in 2009. Today, his working capital exceeds 1,200,000 MNT. For the future, he hopes to have his own mini-supermarket. 

Zorig is a hard-working and modest person and says, "I plan to expand my grocery shop." He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more grocery products to sell at his grocery shop.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products

loans.name: Jamalbubu

texts.en:
Jamalbubu S., 63, is a farmer with eight children. Seven of her children live on their own while the youngest son lives with her and helps in breeding cattle. They started this business with only 1,000 KGS of initial capital and managed to earn around 3,000 KGS in one month. Jamalbubu is also engaged in land cultivating with barley and wheat, which she sells seasonally at the local market places. Her success was achieved due to hard work and strong efforts. Jamalbubu is now applying for a loan of 25,000 KGS to purchase goats and sheep. Revenues from this loan will allow her to further develop her business and improve her living conditions.

Bai-Tushum and Partners, one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan, uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle for breeding.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Life can be simple, but never uninteresting. Imelda D. L. S., 45, proves this to be true in her life. As a CCT* Community Partner, she makes her business everything but stagnant. She is married to Jose, a van controller. Together they live in Baseco, Manila.

Imelda owns a sari-sari (variety) store, where she sells merchandise essential to busy people in her community. There are times when her neighbors are too busy to go to the market or grocery store to purchase their needs. Coming to the rescue, Imelda provides them with what they immediately need such as a bottle of vinegar for cooking, a sachet of shampoo, or a bottle of cold soft drink to quench their thirst. Other than the sari-sari store, Imelda also buys and sells bananas, a favorite fruit of Filipinos, and operates a water refilling station. Being twenty years in business, she earns around Php 750/day.
 
To help her continue the operation of her growing business, she would like to apply for a Php 29,000 loan. She plans to use this money to boost her banana buying and selling business. She will also invest the money in her sari-sari store to further meet the varying needs of her community. She believes that her entrepreneurial skills are being honed and her businesses are becoming more profitable.

There are problems Imelda faces at present, but she considers none of them worth emphasizing. She believes that these are twists and turns in her life that make it more interesting. She is praying for an increased capacity to earn in order to be able to make her business flourish.
	

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: purchase of essential ingredients for banana business

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Yorn S., 45, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. S. raises pigs, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 41 on food and USD 25 on other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a plot of farmland to generate more income from their farming business. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Rajabmurod

texts.ru: Рабимов Рачабмурод житель Вахдатского района. Ему 25 лет. Женат. Детей не имеет. Образование высшее, экономист. По профессии не работает. Он занимается ремонтом автомашин. Работает в Автосервисе. Два года как занимается этим видом деятельности. Кредит берет для покупки автомашины.
texts.en: Rajabmurod R. lives in the Vahdat Region. He is 25 years old. Married, without children. He has a college degree in economics. He does not work in his profession.  He works as a mechanic in an auto repair shop. He has been in this line of work for two years. He is taking out a loan in order to buy a car.

loans.use: Purchasing a car

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
If you do not have much education as a foundation to build on, try banking on experience instead. This is what one person did to overcome life's adversities. Lolita D. S., 63, reached only elementary school, but is now working hard on making her business grow. Being a Community Partner in CCT*, she applies to her business what she learns from her entrepreneurial training and Bible fellowships. She presently lives in Baseco, Manila, with Noviros, her husband who is also a sari-sari (variety) store vendor. 

Lolita co-manages the sari-sari store with Noviros. It is a residential business which has been in operation for fifteen years now. Their family mainly runs the store, catering to the immediate needs of their community, such as rice, milk in sachets, and instant food sold in pouches. Monthly they earn an average income of Php 10,500.

To further help her grow her business, Lolita decided to borrow Php 24,000. She wants to add more groceries to her store and also start selling beverages amd retailing charcoal which is widely used as household fuel in her community. A big part of the loan will go to these purchases, while Lolita intends to use part of the money for the improvement of their house. 

Life is as hard as a rock, but with the wisdom Lolita has gained through her experience, she claims that life can be smooth sailing for her. She hopes to maintain a savings account and dreams of a flourishing grocery business.


*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: purchase of merchandise for the store

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma C. is from the village of Lubid, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 40 years old. Gemma is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling delicacies in the local community. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Gemma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Gemma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en:
Davaasuren is 46 years old and lives with her husband and son in Selenge province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in their own house and fence. Her oldest son attends university while her husband works for the local governor's office as a driver with monthly salary of 200,000 MNT. 

Davaasuren operates an imported household goods business out of rented a stall in a local market. She began her business in 2005 and has since built up a stable and successful operation. Her business has stabilized over the past year and she has begun to integrate herself into the business community. Her earnings have enabled her not only to provide for her entire family but also to enlarge her house and fence. With her business profits, she was able to pay her three children's tuition fees. Two of them have already completed their degree while one still attends university. 

Moreover, she opened saving account in the bank and saves her earnings regularly. For the future, Davaasuren plans to buy a car for her business. She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT in order to increase her working capital by purchasing more consumer goods to sell for upcoming Tsagaan Sar, the Mongolian New Year holiday.

loans.use: To purchase more consumer goods

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila B. is from the village of Sepac, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Mila is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Mila owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Mila has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Mila is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Mila from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Janet's Group

texts.en:
Janet L. is from the village of Lusot, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 25 years old. Janet is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Lavender".

Janet is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Janet owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making dried fish for sale in the community. Janet has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP from the business.

In 2010, Janet joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janet is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Janet from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen lives in Mianchannu which is a small city located in Punjab province, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She owns a 2-room brick house there and has been living in it with her family for past 12 years. She has given birth to 4 sons. Three of them are painters and paint walls and doors on order while the youngest one who is 19 years old has recently passed 14th grade and is looking for a job. 

Her husband's name is W. B. and he operates a grocery shop in the market where he fills the orders of his customers and earns income for the family. As the grocery business has become a  business that is much in demand among people, he has started facing high competition from other grocery shops. 

Therefore, Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk which will help him to fill the orders on time for his customers and make them his permanent customers.  Nasreen is hopeful that an investment will bring more profit to her husband and her family’s financial condition will improve. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop business

loans.name: Evelyn's Group

texts.en:
Evelyn C. is from the village of Lusot Baliangao, Mis. Occ. She is 51 years old. Evelyn is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Lavender".

Evelyn is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling bread to the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Evelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Evelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s dairy business. Her husband has a dairy cow at his home from which he gets around 8-10 kg of milk a day. He sells 1 kg of milk for approximately 45 PKR, which is almost the same in every city. His clientele base is his community. With the loan, he will buy another dairy cow that will increase the milk productivity and will help him to sell to different milk shops as well. She is hopeful that through the loan investment her husband’s financial condition will improve which will result in making her family’s lifestyle better. 

She got married twenty-one years ago and has one son and three daughters. Her son left his education after completing 8th grade and now he operates a construction supplies selling business to financially support the family. Two of her three daughters are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education. She lives with her family in Mian channu which is a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. Her home consists of three rooms. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she established good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow for dairy business

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 40 years old, married, and supports her family by operating two business ventures: hog raising and a frozen products business. She lives in Bago City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of $186. 

Juliet is borrowing 28,000 PHP so that she can fund her operations. This will be her 27th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 25,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Juliet aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Bok Xalaat Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOK XALAAT est formé à la veille de l'inauguration de son Banc Villageois en 2008. Il est formé de 15 femmes qui sont des voisines de quartier. Elles ont comme dénominateur commun le culte du travail. Elles sont des femmes très proches par les liens d'amitié. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de NDIANG MONTAGNE.

Madame AMINATA CISSOKHOU debout à droite de la photo et en foulard vert est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 59 ans. Elle mariée sans enfants mais à la garde de 03 qui lui sont confiés par des parents.

Elle fait un petit commerce. Elle vend sur table des beignets, des jus de fruit naturels, du pain de singe, des balais et autres diverses marchandises. 

Son crédit lui permettra de renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement en marchandises

Son objectif est de construire une cantine qui fera office de boutique. Elle soutien aussi son mari dans la pris en charge de la famille.
texts.en: The solidarity group Bok Xalaat was formed on the eve the opening of its Village Bank in 2008.  It is made up of 15 women who are neighbors from the district.  They share a love of work as their common denominator.  They are closely connected by the ties of friendship.  The group is a member of the Village Bank of Ndiang Montagne.  Mrs. Aminata Cissokhou, standing to the right of the photo and in a green scarf, is the leader of the group.  She is 59 years old.  She is married without children, but she cares for three who were entrusted to her by their parents.  She runs a small business.  She sells doughnuts, natural fruit juices, monkey bread, brooms and various other merchandise from her table.  Her loan will allow her to strengthen the level of stock of her merchandise.  Her goal is to build a cafeteria which will be the office of her shop.  She supports her husband in caring for the family's needs.

loans.use: To strengthen her small business

loans.name: Shahri

texts.ru: Абдулхакова Шахри проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 45 лет. Вдова, имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается торговлей. У нее имеется магазин, где она продает продукты питания и одежду. Этим видом деятельности занимается 19 лет. В продвижении бизнеса ей помогает её старшая дочь. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Shahri A. lives in the Vahdat Region. 45 years of age. A widow with five children. Secondary education. She is a retailer. She keeps a store in which she sells groceries and clothing. She has been in this business for 19 years. Her oldest daughter helps her in the business. She is taking out a loan to increase her saels volume.

loans.use: Increasing sales volume

loans.name: Uur-Tsaih

texts.en:
Uur-Tsaih is 28 years old and lives with her husband and two sons, ages 6 and 8, in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent and fence. Her two sons attend a local primary school.

Uur-Tsaih operates a consumer goods trading business out of her two work places, a shipping container and a pavilion in her town. She began her business in a rented shipping container at the local market with a working capital of 1,500,000 MNT. She has built a stable and successful operation and used her earnings to expand her business by purchasing a shipping container at 2,000,000 MNT in 2008. Today her working capital exceeds 3,500,000 MNT. With her business profits, she was able to buy another pavilion, and she now sells her products out of two spots.

Uurtsaih is a hardworking and modest person and says, "I hope to continue to build and run this business as a stable operation and increase my business profits." She is requesting a 1,800,000 MNT loan to import more products from China.

loans.use: To import more products to sell

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa M. is from the village of Bangko,Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Narcisa is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a tricycle transport service. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $38 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Narcisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel B. is from the village of Tabuan, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 55 years old and married. To make a living, Manuel owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately $68 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Manuel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand his product offering. 

Manuel is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be his 2nd loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
If life is tough, one who wants to win ought to be tougher. Imelda A., 41, thinks so as she strives to give her best in making her business go beyond limits, even without a college background. Imelda is married to Rodelito, a welder, and they live with their children in Baseco, Manila. Two of their children study in high school, while another one is in elementary.

Imelda runs her own sari-sari (variety) store at home. Being twenty years in business, she knows what her community needs and wants to see in her store. With the training she receives from CCT*, she adeptly uses the money on hand to buy the essential merchandise and meet the needs of her customers. Each month she earns an average income of $277. 

To further help her with her business, Imelda decided to borrow 26,000 PHP. With this money she plans to buy food items that she knows her neighbors need daily, such as instant food sold in pouches, soap bars, and powdered milk. She also intends to buy Johnson&Johnson products like talc powder. 

Being tough in meeting life's challenges head on calls for an attitude that focuses on the solution rather than on the problem. Imelda practices this, and admits that no challenge can pull her spirit down. She desires to see her business boom and to maintain the good health of her family. More than anything else, she prays to see her children demonstrating the same kind of toughness she has when it comes to their studies, and finish schooling with flying colors.


*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: purchase of food items for sale

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She operates a food selling stall, making maandazi (a doughnut-like pastry) and chapati (flat bread) for sale. She sells at retail from door to door to her neighbors. Patricia faces the major challenge of delayed payments from those who purchase goods on credit. She hopes to expand and open another business in the future.

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase bags of wheat flour, sacks of sugar and cooking oil. She decided to join the Kiva field partner, Yehu, to access loans and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase bags of wheat flour, sacks of sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen lives in Mian channu, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, and is known for its agriculture industry. She came here sixteen years ago with her family. She is 47 years old and married to H. M., who has an animal selling business. He purchases young goats from the animal market, raises them up and then sells to his customers. His clientele base is butchers. He sells the goats at a good profit. He also operates a donkey cart and offers loading services to his customers. 

Nasreen herself is a housewife who prefers to stay at home and take care of her household responsibilities. She makes the utmost effort to give comfort to her family by taking care of them. She has two sons. Her elder son works as a helper in a nearby hospital while her younger son is studying in 9th grade.
  
She has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for the improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy some goats to sell for a profit. Nasreen hopes that after the loan investment her husband’s business will be in a more profitable position and will result in a better financial situation for her family. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she established good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy some goats for selling

loans.name: Gaudencia

texts.en:
Gaudencia is a widow who lives in Siaton, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a variety store and a carenderia (mini-restaurant). She has two children who are 26 and 20 years old. Gaudencia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1991 because she wanted something better for her family. 

With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gaudencia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 25,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of about $207, raising the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing 25,000 PHP, which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for future household expenses and for her family’s future. Gaudencia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Keva Jumaa

texts.en:
Keva Jumaa S., 37, is from Bombolulu. He is married to Damaris and together they have two children. Keva has been in the transport business for the last three years. This marks his second loan from KADET and with it, he plans to repair his motor bike.

The profits will be directed to the expansion of his business. Keva's dream is to open a retail shop for his wife.

loans.use: To repair his motor bike.

loans.name: Cecelia's Group

texts.en:
Cecelia A. is from the village of Minante 2, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 32 years old. Cecelia is the group leader of a ten-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Cecelia is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs for fattening and sale. She is just starting this business.

In 2007, Cecelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

Cecelia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 7th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Damaris Mukii

texts.en:
Damaris, 50, is married to Mwanzia, who contributes to the family income. She has six children aged between 10 and 26. She has been running her farm for the past four years with a profit of about 30,000 KES.  

This is her third loan from KADET Ltd after successfully repaying the previous ones well and in good time. She hopes to grow variety of crops and give her children a quality education.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fence the farm.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.en:
Having attained high school education, Sebastian B., 57, wants to achieve more in life, for himself and his family. Sebastian, a widower, lives in Baseco Port Area, Manila along with his four children, who are all working.

Sebastian presently owns and manages a rolling store which caters mainly to people near their residence in Baseco. He sells mainly plastic wares, electronic items, household detergents and other items commonly used for household chores among Filipino families.  He buys these items in bulk quantities and retail them piecemeal with a minimum mark up. Sebastian earns a net income of Php10,000 monthly, which he uses to meet the needs of the entire family.

To help continue the operation of his business, he would like to apply for a Php12,000 loan.  He plans to use this loan to purchase additional items to restock his current inventory. Basically, the loan will serve as additional capital that will enable Sebastian to make his business more profitable and lead to more savings.

Sebastian dreams that his business will continue to grow which would help him sustain his family needs and send two of his children to school up to college level.  He also prays for good health and to be able to enjoy life.  As CCT community partner, he faithfully attends to their weekly fellowship* meeting where he can also gain strength and inspiration from the Word of God  that he receives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional stock for his store

loans.name: Estrilla

texts.en:

To make a living, Estrilla owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling soft drinks in the local community. Estrilla has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Estrilla joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estrilla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. Estrilla is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Estrilla from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

With the profits from this loan, he hopes to take up big contracts and expand his trade. He also desires to build a better house for his family and give them a better life.

Mwanatumu faces a major challenge with the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 65,000 she wants to start a fish selling business and purchase sacks of dry fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

S. is requesting a loan of  1000 USD to purchase a plot of farmland to improve the farming business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva’s partner.

The profits made will be used to pay college fees for her two children. Her desire is to see her business grow and be able to have many cows.

C. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to repair her husband’s car to improve his business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva’s partner. C.'s husband appears in the photograph because C. is not available.

Mathew is 50 years old and married to Rose who contributes to the family income. He supports 10 members of his family. He has been farming for the past two years with an income of about KES. 20,000.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD  and he intends to use it to buy farm equipment such as jembe (a hoe), fork and fertilizer. He hopes to grow a variety of crops in his farm to increase his profit and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
39-year-old Cleofe is a farmer from the town of Banga, South Cotabato. She plants and harvests rice and corn crops. Cleofe then sells her harvest to the market. Cleofe is also very happy to share with us that she was able to put up a small sari-sari store. She sells various products like sugar, soy sauce and others. Cleofe hopes for her store to grow as well.

Cleofe joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cleofe has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Cleofe is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang S., 56, is married and resides with her two children in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. S. sells rice, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 4 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 30 on food and USD 65 on the other necessary expenses. 

Neang is requesting a loan of USD 750 to purchase a motorbike for the family use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva’s partner. S. appears in the photograph with her daughter.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Haldardjan

texts.en:
Haldardjan I., 60, lives with his family in Tashkiya village. He has three sons and one daughter, who was adopted from an orphanage by his family and became the light of their life. Haldardjan is known as a hard-working and energetic person.

Haldardjan was born into a low-income farm worker’s family and from early childhood helped his parents in farming. Gaining a wide experience in stockmanship, he started his cattle breeding business ten years ago and it became the main source of income for his family. Due to his strong efforts, he has developed his farm and today earns about 15,000 KGS a month through selling milk and meat products to his loyal customers. 
Haldardjan plans to use the loan of 28,000 KGS to broaden his business through buying a bull-calf for fattening and reselling. With the revenues from the loan, he plans to give a good education to his daughter and hold his youngest son’s marriage. Haldardjan is doing his best to provide good conditions in which his children can develop. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners, one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan, uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating tricycle transport services. Hero has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Hero joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hero is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Hero from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a resident of Mian Channu, a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She is a housewife who prefers to stay at home and attend to her household responsibilities. Elizabeth is the mother of a daughter and two sons. All of them are studying at local schools. She is a very supportive lady, always ready to help her family at difficult times.  

She is married to Sarfaraz, who is a painter by profession and paints walls, homes, buildings, etc., on contract. His business doesn’t guarantee that he will get work every day, but when he manages to get work, it continues for a few months and earns him a good income. 

Her husband wants to buy different colors of paint and also paint brushes, so Elizabeth has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah. She is hopeful that an investment will help her husband fulfill the demands of his clients and make better profits.
 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year, she established good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy paint and brushes for her husband's painting business

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel S. is 34 years old, married, and supports her family by operating two business ventures: fruits and vegetables vending and motorcycle transport. 

She lives in Brgy. Balirong, Naga City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fruits and vegetables vending and motorcycle transport businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,500. 

Ethel is borrowing PHP 12,000 so that she can purchase more stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell. This will be her ninth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ethel aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Thun

texts.en:
Thun S., 55, is married and resides with her three children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations.

S. sells Cambodian noodles, earning an income of US $2 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of US $2 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

Each month, the family has to spend US $82 on food and $5 on other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of US $600 to purchase more fertilizer to improve the farm. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie S. S. is from the village of Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. She is 34 years old. Rosalie is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Rosalie sells seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Rosalie has been engaged in her business for more than six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosalie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Rosalie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosalie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Rosalie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam S., 42, is married and resides with her five children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations.

S. sells groceries, earning an income of US $2 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman, earning an income of US $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

Each month, the family has to spend US $60 on food and $18 on the other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of US $600 to purchase a motorbike for family use. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a bundle of tablecloths for resale

loans.name: Saen

texts.en: Mrs. Saen P. is a married woman with three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, one employed in a private company and the third studying in the local public school. She and her family live in Kampeaeng Tboung village in Takeo province. She was born in 1954. She is a noodle seller in the local village, where she earns money to support her family. She is also a pig breeder and since her pig breeding is going well, she wants to expand. For this purpose, Mrs. Saen P. is asking for a loan to buy a mother pig for breeding and pig food. Her husband, Mr. Sum In, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow rice to sell to support his family. Her husband is taken the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a mother pig for breeding and pig food.

loans.name: Revelita Domingo's Group

texts.en:
Revelita D. is from the village of Pulay, Luna, Isabela. She is the leader of a five-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Revelita is is 52 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Revelita owns and operates a general store selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Revelita has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Revelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital.
