This Kiva borrower is a 35-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two school-aged children. After noticing the absence of such business in his town, he decided to open an entertainment shop in 2005. He is the only income provider for the family.  

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renovate his shop using new bricks and doing some painting so he can increase the number of customers visiting him and allow them to enjoy a comfortable pleasant place.

loans.use: to renovate his shop

loans.name: Joyce Njoki

texts.en:
Joyce is widowed and is a mother of four children – aged six, nine, twelve and sixteen. They live in Magina Limuru, on the outskirts of Nairobi. She relies solely on crop farming and livestock keeping to support her family. She has been farming for a period of sixteen years now. 

With this loan, she plans to buy a calf and two sheep to increase her livestock in order to earn more income. This is her third loan from KADET.  She had paid off her previous loans well and on time.  

In future she plans to buy  a dairy cow for milk production,so that she can start selling milk to the residents of Magina for better income and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy a calf and two sheep

loans.name: Frank Nero's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers from the Our Lady of Gaudalupeh Primary School in Lunsar, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This school was opened in 1960 by the Catholics to boost education in Lunsar  town and it environs.  Presently, the school has 36 teachers and 1,200 pupils.  Over the years, Guadalupeh Primary School, which is the only girls primary school in Lunsar town, has scored a lot of successes. Last academic year, for example, the school came in first in the National Primary Schools Examination (NPSE) for the whole Northern Province, and third for the entire country.
 
This is the first loan this school is accessing from Kiva through SMT. School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not be able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or they can invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Fifty-six-year-old Frank N. K. (back row right) is the headmaster at the school and has been a teacher for 32 years. He was born in Yele village, Tonkolili district, northern Sierra Leone. He is married with 8 children – 7 biological and 1 foster child. Frank’s wife is a cook and his children are attending schools – 3 in primary school, 2 in secondary school and 3 in college.  Mr. K. has applied for this loan in order to pay college fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay college fees for his children.

loans.name: Préférence Group

texts.fr: Mbambu B.  est entrepreneur, présidente du groupe Préférence, âgée de 40 ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants.  Son conjoint est un Maitre Cuisinier dans un hôtel de la place. Elle fait le petit commerce de divers dans un kiosque érigé sur l’avenue Osso. Avant de stabiliser son activité, elle vendait des patates douces, puis les habits usagers.  Plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouveaux produits (Fanta, sucres, savons, habits, cigarettes, pétrole, allumettes, sel de cuisine, babouches,  etc.).  En plus, elle ambitionne construire confortablement une maison dans le quartier populaire Ndosho. La cliente Mbambu B.  remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Le groupe préférence est constitué de 39 membres.
texts.en:
Mbambu B., an entrepreneur and the leader of the Préférence group,i s4 0 years of age, married, and the mother of seven. Her life partner is a chef cook in a local hotel.

She has a small business selling miscellaneous items in kiosk on Osso avenue. Before settling on this business, she used to sell sweet potatoes, and later second-hand clothing. Later on, she received a loan of $50 from IMF Hekima. This new credit will allow her to stock up new items (Fanta, sugar, soap, clothing, cigarettes, gasoline, matches, table salt, slippers, etc). In addition, her goal is to be able to build a proper house in the working-class district of Ndosho. As a customer of Hekima, Mbambu appreciates its work to support the poor who are excluded from the traditional banking system. The Préférencegroup consists of 39 members.

loans.use: Fanta, sugar, soap, clothing items, cigarettes, gazoline, matches, table salt, slippers  etc

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a food selling stall, selling wholesale and from door to door. Her husband contributes to meeting the family's basic needs.  Regina faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the rainy winter season, the availability of food for sale is low compared to the dry summer season where the demand is high. She hopes to become a big supplier of cloth in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to start selling clothes, purchase a bundle of cloth and leso's( Kikoi's: African print cloth) for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To start selling clothes and purchase bundles of cloth for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase timber and iron sheets to renovate her house

loans.name: Slmb Pri.sch.jnr.lunsar Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you teachers of the SLMB Primary School Junior, Lunsar town. This school was founded in 1964 by the Sierra Leone Muslim Brotherhood Mission to give education to the children of the community. The SLMB Primary school is staffed with 24 teachers and has an enrollment of 720 pupils. This is the first loan that teachers of this institution have benefited from Kiva lenders.

Mohamed Iyen K. is the leader of this group of teachers. The 40-year-old Mohamed was born in Lunsar town, in northern Sierra Leone. He has been in the teaching profession for eight years now. Mohamed is married to a businesswoman and they have four children. Mohamed is requesting a loan of SLL 1,050,000 to invest in his business. Mohamed used the first loan he received from SMT to start a small business in order to compliment his monthly salary. Having paid SMT successfully, he is now requesting a new loan from Kiva lenders in order to further expand his business. He will buy items like cigarettes, milk, soap, etc. to add to his business.   

School staff from this institution, like many other schools staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise have not been able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

(In the right of the photo is the head teacher at the school who did not collect the loan but serves as their guarantor. And attached on the left of the photo is a snap shot of a borrower who was not able to be present for a group photo)

loans.use: To buy items like cigarettes, milk, soap, etc. to add to his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase firewood to sell

loans.name: Nikoloz

texts.en:
Nikoloz lives in a small village called Mukhrani, located in one of the agricultural area of the country – Kartli. He is 28 years old, unmarried and lives with his parents and brother. Nikoloz’s mother is a housewife and his father is a taxi driver. Nikoloz’s contribution to his family’s income is very important - approximately 65%. 

Nikoloz runs a car washing facility in the village. In addition to this, Nikoloz recently constructed a building for a grocery shop. The building is next to the car washing box. With this loan Nikoloz plans to renovate the building and open the shop to the first customers. According to Nikoloz’s estimations the shop will have a sufficient number of clients and will be profitable. A part of the profit received from the retail trade will be used for expansion of the car washing facility.

loans.use: To purchase materials for grocery shop renovation

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana M., a senior high school graduate, is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a farmer. They live in Abura.

Juliana cooks waakye, a stew of beans cooked with rice, to sell. She has been doing so for ten years. Juliana uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Juliana will use her loan to purchase ingredients to cook more waakye so as to meet the demands of her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to educate her dependents.

In the photo, Juliana is dishing out some waakye into a polythene bag.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients for waakye

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, 38 years old, is a married man with three children. They live in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda, with a family goal of building a permanent residence.

George is into growing tea and he hires land to do so. He started as one of the workers on an estate but later decided to become an outgrower. [Synonymous with contract farming, the outgrower system provides for private and public firms to purchase the harvests of individual farmers.]

George is requesting a loan to hire land for growing tea.

loans.use: To rent land for growing tea.

loans.name: Beatriz Stella

texts.es:
Debido a las necesidades económicas para sobrellevar los gastos del hogar y sacar adelante a sus tres hijos en compañía de su esposo, Beatriz Stella R. M., decidió desde hace 10 años montar su propio negocio, una venta de comidas que inició con las tradicionales empanadas y que hoy ya ofrece muchos más productos para deleitar a los clientes de la zona. 

De domingo a domingo esta emprendedora trabaja en su negocio esperando incrementar sus ventas con el fin de continuar supliendo las necesidades de su hogar, aunque como ella misma lo afirma, no es fácil puesto que hay días en los que las ventas son pocas, lo que no le permite obtener buenas ganancias; sin embargo Beatriz no se rinde y sueña con tener un restaurante propio en el que pueda ofrecer variedad de platos. 

Actualmente Beatriz necesita de un préstamo para realizar algunas reformas locativas en su casa y allí poder ubicar su negocio para que atender mejor a sus clientes e incrementar sus ventas, así mismo, necesita comprar insumos para empezar a ofrecer nuevos productos.
texts.en:
Given the financial requirements to cover the household expenses and to provide for their three children, Breatriz Stella R. Mejia and her husband decided 10 years ago to set up their own business. She sells prepared foods, though she started out selling traditional breads. Today she sells many other products to cater to the clients in the community. 

From Sunday to Sunday this enterprising woman works her business, endeavoring to increase her sales in order to keep the ability to cover the needs of their household. She attests to the fact that it is not easy and there are days when the sales are low, resulting in diminished earnings. But Beatriz never gives up and she dreams to have her own restaurant from where to sell a variety of foods. 

Beatriz requests a loan to carry out some improvements in her home, to be able to set up her business and improve the way she attends to her clients, and increase her sales. She also needs to purchase ingredients to start making new foods.

loans.use: To remodel their home and to purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua A. is divorced and takes care of five dependants. She sells cassava and is a stone cracker at Abura. The income she makes from her sales is used to educate, feed and clothe her dependants. Efua will add the loan to her working capital to expand her stone cracking business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to build a house. At the time of visit, she was at the stone cracking site. The cassava was at home.

loans.use: As working capital to expand her stone cracking business.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a firewood selling business for the last three years, selling at the market and at retail to her neighbors and food vendors. Mwanajuma faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to operate at wholesale in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to pay school fees for her children. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to uplift her family living standards.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Abdul Hamid's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers from the RC Boys Primary School in Lunsar, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This school was opened in 1935 by the Roman Catholic church to educate the children of Lunsar and it environs. Presently, the school has 18 teachers and about 800 pupils. Over the years, the school has produced a great number of lecturers, teachers, and other professionals in different walks of life. 

This is the first loan this school is accessing from Kiva through SMT. School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not be able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Forty-two year old Abdul H. T. (pictured back row, second from right) is a teacher at the school, and leader of this group. Born in Freetown, Abdul now lives and works in his mother’s hometown of Lunsar. He is a class VI primary school teacher and has been in the teaching profession for seven years now. His wife too is a teacher. Mr. T. has requested this loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy pieces of furniture (such as chairs, tables, etc.) for his parlor. This will help him a lot and will make his life comfortable, Mr. T. said.

loans.use: To buy pieces of furniture (such as chairs, tables, etc.) for parlor.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 52-year-old married man living with his wife and three young children. He is from Lebanon. He has specialized in baking bread and pastries for 20 years and in 2000, he decided to open a small bakery. Despite his old age, he is doing big efforts to proceed with his work to handle his family’s expenses. He has obtained his first Kiva loan and he was a very good client with payments on time. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase his inventory to produce more and, as a result, get higher profits.

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Kathem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a 35-year-old husband and father of four children.

In 2000, Kathem opened his own audio-systems’ maintenance store. He repairs and sells different audio-system equipment. He is becoming well known in his region and has an excellent reputation.

He applied for a $2,700 loan in 2010 because of his need to repair and renovate his store’s floor and walls. He is aiming to expand his business and make it bigger.

loans.use: To repair and renovate his store’s floor and walls

loans.name: Abu Bakarr's Group

texts.en:
In the photo above are members of the AD Wurie Secondary School, situated in Lunsar, a town in northen Sierra Leone. These diligent and hard working teachers have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of SLL 3,300,000.00 in order to help them pay school fees for their children or invest in business or buy pieces of furniture, house building materials, or a plot of land, etc. AD Wurie Secondary School was founded in 2003. The school is staffed with 26 teachers with an enrollment of 600-700 pupils. 

With the help of this loan, leader of this group, Abu Bakarr T. (pictured second from right) will use his share of the laon (SLL 400,000) to buy house building materials like iron corrugated zinc, nails, boards, etc. Abu Bakarr is a 32 year old man, married to a teacher, and they have four children, two of whom are attending primary schools and the rest are not of school going age. Abu Bakarr was born in Lunsar town.

loans.use: To buy house building materials like iron corrugated zinc, nails, boards, etc.

loans.name: Langoni

texts.en:
Langoni is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a vegetables stall business for the last two years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her husband also contributes to their income. Langoni faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to establish a big grocery shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes and green vegetables for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, and green vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Salah

texts.en: This borrower is from Iraq. He is 22 years old and lives with one brother. In 2008, Salah decided to open his own barber shop after having gained good experience in this field. He is well known in his area and has a good reputation. He is requesting an $1800 loan to renovate his shop and buy a small generator. He aims to improve his business and to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate his shop and buy a small generator

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 21-year-old single man living with his parents and three siblings. He is from Lebanon. He has been working as a gypsum specialist for 5 years, sticking with multiple construction projects. He also works as a freelance gypsum decorator depending on customers' demands. He cooperates with his parents in the family’s income. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional products and tools so he can work in a more professional way, allowing him to increase his sales and therefore his income.

loans.use: to purchase additional products and tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an oven for baking sweets

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a 32-year-old married man and the father of two children. Ahmad has long experience in the calligraphy and billboards business. In 1991, he opened his own business in a commercial area, because almost all businesses need advertisement. He is well known and has an excellent reputation.

Ahmad is requesting a $2400 loan to buy an air conditioner and some business tools. He also wants to pay the annual rent expense for his shop. He is planning to develop his work and expand in the future.

loans.use: To buy an air conditioner and some business tools, and pay the annual rent for his shop

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy N. lives in the Nabulagala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 7 children, seven of whom are in school. Teddy has a business of poultry farming. She has been in this business for 8 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Teddy sells her products in a shop, by means of wholesale/retail.

Teddy has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more poultry feed and chicks. She also generates additional income through selling scrap. The main business challenge(s) for Teddy include thieves and transportation of chicken feed. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to buy a plot of land where she can build more poultry houses. Teddy lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more poultry feed and chicks.

loans.name: Esther Wanjiru

texts.en:
Esther  Wanjiru is 37 years old.  She is married to Joseph Muhia, who also works to contribute to the family's income.  She has three children – aged 16, 14, and 12. She has been selling cereals for a period of six years, earning an income of 10,000 KES per month. 

Esther has a very good history with KADET.   She is applying for her fourth loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous ones well and in good time. She hopes to be a leading cereals businesswoman and become a supplier, and to give her children a quality education.

loans.use: To buy maize, beans and groundnuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a site for selling building blocks.

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es:
Elvis vive en alquiler en la zona de Villa Dolores, de la ciudad de  El Alto, tiene dos hijos, el señor es chofer taxista, con los ingresos que obtiene se mantienen; en anterior crédito realizó el mantenimiento de su movilidad. Ahora necesita otro crédito para  comprar un motor a medio uso y transformar su movilidad de gasolina a gas licuado, para ahorrar el costo de combustible. El señor se encuentra satisfecho con los créditos que le otorgamos.

Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito, se considera buen cliente.
texts.en:
Elvis lives in a rented space in the community of Villa Dolores in the city of El Alto. He has two children and he works as a taxi driver. He is able to support his children with his earnings. The previous loan was use to carry out maintenance repairs to his car. Currently he requires a new loan to purchase a new engine and to convert his car from using gasoline to propane, in order to save on fuel expenses. He is very happy with the loans that he has received. 

His personal history qualifies him to access a new loan and he is considered to be a good client.

loans.use: To purchase an engine for his car.

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es:
Genaro vive en casa propia en Achacachi, en la comunidad de Tipampa de la Provincia Omasuyos, es casado, tiene dos hijos, el señor es chofer y su esposa es productora lechera, con los ingresos que obtiene se mantienen, en anterior crédito realizó la compra de ganado lechero. Ahora necista un nuevo crédito para comprar una hectárea de terreno para su ganado. El señor se encuentra satisfecho con los créditos que le otorgamos.

Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito, se considera buen cliente.
texts.en:
Genaro lives in his own home in Achacachi, in the community of Tipampa of the Omasuyos province.  He is married and he has 2 children. He is a driver and his wife is a dairy producer. The income that he earns is able to support them. The previous loan was to purchase a dairy cow. He requests a new loan to purchase a hectare of land for his livestock. He is very happy with the loans he has received. 

His personal history qualifies him to access a new loan and he is considered to be a good client.

loans.use: To purchase land for his livestock.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 41 years old, married and has three children.

Ali decided to open his own business so he chose to own a juice shop with all kinds of juices and soft drinks. He is becoming well known and has an excellent reputation in his local community.

He is requesting $1,800 to install shutters in his shop and increase his inventories. He is aiming to grow bigger in the future and increase his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To install shutters for his shop and increase his inventories

loans.name: Amir

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 40 years old and lives with three family members.

In 2008, Amir opened his own food market in a populated area. He is becoming well known and has a good reputation.

He is requesting a $3000 loan to install an external ceiling and shutters and renovate his shop. He is aiming to grow bigger and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To install an external ceiling and shutters and to renovate his shop

loans.name: Meali

texts.en:
MeA. is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family. 

She has operated a vegetable stall business for the last two years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she sells fresh water which contributes to her other source of income. MeA. faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the rainy winter season, the demand for vegetables is low compared to the dry summer season where the demand for vegetables is high. She hopes to be self-reliant in her business in the future.

With the Kshs 60,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, vegetables, potatoes and onions for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of tomatoes, vegetables, potatoes and onions for sale.

loans.name: Lukiya

texts.en:
Lukiya N. lives in the Kawempe Bubajjwe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. Lukiya has a business of a restaurant. She has been in this business for 6 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Lukiya sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.

Lukiya has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, cassava, and sweet and Irish potatoes. The main business challenge(s) for Lukiya include thieves and the rainy season because she works from a muddy place.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked hotel. Lukiya lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, cassava, sweet and irish potatoes.

loans.name: Bugongi United Savings And Credit Group A-Kihihi

texts.en:
37-year-old Christmas H. is a happily married father of 5.  He has been in the farming and coffee selling business for the last 3 years. H. is a  traveling business man who carries himself around with a lot of optimism. He is a firm believer that hard work pays. Because he wants to make the most out of his business, he incessantly travels long distances to sell his coffee to old and new customers alike. He also sells to cooperative unions around Kihihi district. He says he began this business with savings from a modest crude alcohol selling business. Monthly, this business generates for him 350,000 shillings.   With this loan, H. says he is going to purchase more bags of coffee to resell. 

H. belongs to Bugongi United savings and credit group-Kihihi.

loans.use: To purchase coffee to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional tools and equipments

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua N. prepares kenkey and banku at Abura for sale. She is married and has four children. Her husband works with the lottery. Ekua has been selling kenkey and banku (types of dumpling) for four years. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to prepare kenkey and banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more maize to prepare kenkey and banku for sale.

loans.name: Rutuba

texts.en:
Rutuba is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a food selling stall for the last two years, selling as retail to her neighbours and passersby. Her husband also contributes to the family's basic needs. Rutuba faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand and meet her customers' needs and satisfaction in the future. 

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sacks of beans, sugar and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, sacks of beans, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence N. lives in the Lubaga road, Kitawuluzi neighborhood, in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 6 children, all of whom are in school. Florence has a business of mini-bakery. She has been in this business for less than one year, and she works 7 days out of every week. Florence sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale/retail.

Florence has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more jerry cans of cooking oil and cartons of baking flour. The main business challenge(s) for Florence include transport, and ever increasing prices of cooking oil and baking flour. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to run a fully stocked bakery. Florence lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more jerry cans of cooking oil, cartons of baking flour.

loans.name: Jennifer Kalekye

texts.en:
Jeniffer is 47 years old.  She is married to Joshua, who also works to contribute to the family income. She has six children.

Jeniffer has been practicing mix farming and operating a grocery store for a period of one year.  From these activities, she earns an income of about KES. 30,000 per  month.

This is Jeniffer's fourth loan from KADET LTD.  She successfully repaid the previous ones well and in good time.  Jeniffer will use the loan to buy a dairy goat, fertilizer, and onions seedlings.   She hopes to expand her business, give her children a quality education, and improve their living standards.

loans.use: To buy a dairy goat, fertilizer and onions seedlings.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama Y. sells fresh eggs and bags of water at Abura.  Ama has been through junior high school. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a carpenter. She assists her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. Demand for her goods is increasing, and she is requesting to use the loan to purchase additional goods to sell. She anticipates reinvesting her new profits.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua M. is married and has one child. She has received a junior high education. Efua sells powder and panties at Abura. She is a hairdresser as well, which she has been doing for three years. Her husband is a mason. Efua uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Efua will use the loan to expand her hairdressing business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to buy a dryer.

loans.use: To expand her hairdressing business.

loans.name: Moses Macharia

texts.en:
Moses is 35 years old and is married to Rahab Wanjiku.   They have  two children.  He has been farming for a period of 14 years, earning an income of about KES. 10,000 per month.  His wife supports him with his farming activity.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD.  He intends to use it to buy fertilizer and spray, and to pay for the labour. He hopes to  give his children a quality education and improve their living standards.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer & sprays, and pay for labour

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret N. lives in the Lubaga road, Kitawuluzi neighborhood, in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother and nephew). Margaret has a business of making photograph envelopes. She has been in this business for 8 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Margaret sells her products door-to door, by means of wholesale/retail.

Margaret has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of papers. The main business challenge(s) for Margaret include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to get a shop where she can sell her envelopes from. Margaret lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of papers.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi E. sells charcoal at Abura. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a mason. Esi has been selling charcoal for ten years. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy extra bags of charcoal for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: To buy extra bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Jacinta Nyambura

texts.en:
Jacinta is 58 years old. She is married to John who contributes to the family income. She keeps livestock to sell after fattening. She has been in the business for six years with an income of about 20,000 KES per month.

This is Jacinta's fourth loan from KADET LTD. She successfully repaid the previous one. She plans to use the loan to buy bulls to fatten and to sell later.

She hopes to be a leading livestock dealer and to be able to supply or rather sell the bulls to the butcheries in the area.

loans.use: To buy bulls to fatten and to sell later

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia N. lives in the Kitawuluzi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, none of whom who is in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren).

Asia has a business of selling roasted sweet potatoes and bananas. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Asia sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Asia has requested a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sweet potatoes, bunches of bananas, and maize. She also generates additional income through selling second hand shoes. The main business challenge(s) for Asia include seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to deal in shoes only (import). Asia lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees for her grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sweet potatoes, maize and bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama F. operates a grocery shop at Abura. Ama has acquired a junior high level of education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a mason. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy other varieties of groceries to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build another shop.

loans.use: To buy other varieties of groceries to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 24-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and two siblings. He started to work as a freelance wall foliage specialist at a very young age. He also works as a home painter and decorator. He helps his father meet the family’s income. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renew his tools so he can improve his business operation and earn more income. He is very positive about his future and hopes to deal with several construction projects.

loans.use: to renew his tools

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa T. is a single parent taking care of four children. She has been through senior high school. Adjoa prepares Fante kenkey (type of dumpling) for sale at Abura. Adjoa uses her income to see to the well-being of her family. Adjoa will use the loan to purchase more maize to be able to produce in a larger quantity for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more maize to be able to produce kenkey in a larger quantity for sale.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca B. lives in the Makerere Kikoni neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has seven children, all of whom are in school. Rebecca has a business of selling second hand shoes. She has been in this business for 2 1/2 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.

Rebecca sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Rebecca has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bales of second hand shoes. She also generates additional income through part time teaching. The main business challenge(s) for Rebecca include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler. Rebecca lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand shoes.

loans.name: Gabael

texts.es:
El Joven Gabael de 21 años de edad, vive con su esposa Sara Maria Zamora con quien tiene un hijo de dos años, ella cuida de su hijo y le ayuda en los quehaceres del Hogar y la administracion del Negocio, habitan en El Barrio San Antonio de la Primera entrada 2 1/2 cuadras al este, en el Municipio de Juigalpa Chontales, Gabael tiene un Botiquin Veterinario establecido, el cual se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 3 años, de donde obtiene sus ingresos mensuales para los gastos del hogar y los compromisos de pago, es una parsona responsable, activa con sueños por delante, 

Solicita credito con la ayuda de Kiva para continuar en el mercado del Comercio para aumentar su inventario y de esta manera dar mayor cobertura a su clientela.  

Su mayor sueño es que su negocio crezca y no le falte el pan de cada dia.
texts.en:
Young Gabael is 21 and lives with his wife Sara Maria Zamora, with whom he has a two-year-old child. Sara takes care of the child and helps him with the household chores and running the business. They live in the San Antonio de la Primera Entrada neighbourhood, 2 1/2 blocks to the east, in the Juigalpa Chontales municipality. Gabael has an established veterinary store, which he has run for three years. This business provides him with a  monthly income to cover the household costs and his loan payments. He is a responsible and active person with dreams for the future.
He is requesting this loan with the help of Kiva to continue as a merchant and increase his inventory, in order to satisfy his clientele. 

His greatest dream is for his business to grow and to never lack his daily bread.

loans.use: the sale of veterinary products

loans.name: Ashietu

texts.en:
Ashietu W. sells porridge at Abura. She is married and has seven dependants. Her husband is a chainsaw operator. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

At the time of visit, Ashietu had finished selling the porridge for the day. She has in her hand the corn dough she uses for the porridge.

loans.use: To buy more maize to expand her business.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana  tiene su propio negocio desde hace nueve años, una tapicería que logro empezar junto a su esposo.
Anteriormente trabajo en zona franca, para cubrir los gastos básicos de agua, luz entre otros. Hoy en día esta trabando en su tapicería. En donde con los financiamiento ha crecido en producción como en sus niveles de venta, siendo Afodenic el medio de su crecimiento, con quince ciclos en donde ha mejorado su vivienda, aumentado sus ventas.
Con este nuevo crédito pondrá cerámica a su sala ya que aun es de tierra y desea hacer la mejora para estar en mejores condiciones de higiene. Comprara  cuarenta metros de cerámica, bondex, porcelana, separadores entre otros y comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Ana has had her own business for nine years-- a tapestry store which she started with her husband.
She previously worked in a free port to cover her basic costs such as water and electricity, among others. She is now working in her tapestry store, which has grown with the help of loans, both in its level of production and its level of sales. Afodenic has provided the loans for the business' growth. In fifteen cycles she has improved her home and increased her sales.
With this new loan she will install ceramic in a room of her home, since it currently has a dirt floor and she wants to make this improvement to improve her hygiene.
She will purchase fourty metres of ceramic, bondex, porcelain and separators, among other items, to start the job.

loans.use: she will purchase ceramic to put on the floor, in order to achieve better hygiene and comfort for her family.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. sells rice water (rice porridge) in the mornings by moving from one area to the other at Abura. Mary has received a junior high education. She is married to a driver and has a child. Mary has been selling rice water for three years. She assists her husband in taking care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy additional rice, milk and sugar to prepare more porridge for sale. She hopes to reinvest the new profits.

loans.use: To buy additional rice, milk and sugar to prepare more porridge for sale.

loans.name: Bugongi United Savings And Credit Group B-Kihihi

texts.en:
30 year old T. Peter has been selling crude liquor for the last 5 years as a means of earning his livelihood.  It goes without saying that this beverage is in high favour with many rank and file folks around his neighborhood.  For this reason, Peter has been able to make ends meet though not as effectively as he would want.  The reason for this he says is because unlike other beverages like beers which are taken by middle and high income earners, crude alcohol is mostly consumed by low income earners with paltry cash. 

This business, Peter reveals, was begun with savings from his produce sales business, which is still a business for him, though he has less time for it at the present time.  When he is not there to see the day to day running of business, his wife with whom he has 5 kids is always there to run it.  Monthly, this business generates him 200,000 shillings.  With this loan, Peter says he is going to buy more jerrycans of crude alcohol to resell.  Peter belongs to Bugongi United Savings and Credit group-Kihihi.

loans.use: The purchase of more jerrycans of crude alcohol to resell.

loans.name: Janett Del Socorro

texts.es: Janett del Socorro tiene  su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general. La ubicación de su negocio es en el mercado, en donde la mayoría de sus clientes saben que ella les brinda buen precio. Se levanta todos los días temprano pues tiene que abrir su local para atender a sus clientes. Ella está solicitando este crédito para la compra de uniformes, camisas, faldas, trajes, calzado, cosméticos, toallas, sabanas y pantalones. Este no es el primer crédito que ha realizado, ya que han sido necesarios para su negocio.
texts.en: Janette del Socorro has a business selling general merchandise. Her business is located in the market and the majority of her clients know that she gives them accessible prices. She starts her days very early in the morning to set up her stand and to attend to her clients.  She requests a loan to purchase uniforms, shirts, skirts, suits, shoes, cosmetics, bath towels, bed sheets, and pants. This is not the first loan that she has accessed for her business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Mi Banquito Group

texts.es: LA Alcancía Comunal “Mi banquito” es un grupo conformado por 8 personas que residen en una zona rural, son arduos trabajadores, cada uno dedicado a distintas actividades. Ciceli tiene 33 años de edad y dos hijos dependientes de ella,   ejerce el cargo de presidenta del grupo, se dedica a  la producción y venta de Alfalfa y Flores  desde hace 12 años, es una persona de trato amable, su negocio es familiar. Venden flores en diferentes mercados de Lima, poseen chacras en un anexo de Huarochiri, se dedican al trabajo desde las 4:00 am diariamente  además de sembrar, cosechan Alfalfa. Ciceli nos manifiesta que al obtener más capital lo invertiría en los abonos y requerimientos de su negocio. Esta muy agradecida por los préstamos para sus negocios. En la fotografía Podemos apreciar a la alcancía Comunal “Mi banquito” contentos en su reciente reunión de desembolso, en casa de una de  las  socias.
texts.en:
The Mi Banquito ["My Little Bank"] Communal Bank is a group made up of 8 people who live in a rural zone. They are hard-workers and each one has a different job.
Ciceli is 33 and has 2 dependent children. She is the group president and has produced and sold alfalfa and flowers for 12 years. She is a person who provides good servce, and her business is a family business. They sell flowers in the various markets in Lima, and have farms in an annex of Huarochiri. They start working at 4:00 am every day, sowing and harvesting alfalfa. Ciceli told us that when she gets this loan she will invest in manure and other needs for her business. She is very grateful for these loans for her businesses. 
In the photo, we can see the happy Mi Banquito Communal Bank members at their recent payment meeting in the home of one of the members.

loans.use: to purchase manure for her farm where she grows flowers and alfalfa

loans.name: Cristhian Gonzalo

texts.es:
Cristhian es un padre de familia muy dedicado al trabajo, así como al comercio para poder cubrir todos los gastos.
Hoy en día esta laborando en zona franca de operario en donde ofreces sus productos de cosméticos ya que tiene varios años en el negocio, y captado clientes en su área de trabajo, a si como el ingreso de una casa en la capital de Managua que alquila. Logrando poder dar a sus cinco hijo lo necesario en alimentación y estudios.
Hoy en donde habita ha hecho su casa de concreto con financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado mediante créditos, lo que está contento por hacer posible una vivienda mejor.
 Con este nuevo crédito hará un cuarto, en donde tiene comprado arena y piedrín. Lo que comprara piedras, cemento, hierro, para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Cristhian is a father who is very dedicated to his work as a salesman to be able to meet his family’s expenses.
At present, he is working in a free zone selling makeup and has done so for several years and acquired many regular customers. Cristhian also has income from a house in Managua that he rents. He has been able to give his five children all that they need for their food and studies.
Cristhian lives in a home built out of cement with loans received from Afodenic (Kiva’s field partner) and he is very happy to have a better place to live.
With this new loan, Cristhian will build a room and he already has the sand and gravel. He will buy stones, cement, and iron to begin his work.

loans.use: To buy construction material to build a room adjoining his home.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua N. is a single parent taking care of one child. She cooks yams for sale at Abura, which she has been doing for two years. Ekua uses her income to see to the well-being of the family. Ekua will use the loan to purchase extra yams and other ingredients to cook for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to add the cooking of other foods.

In her right hand she is showing a sample of the cooked cocoyam she sells.

loans.use: purchase extra yams and other ingredients to cook for resale

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua K. is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. She has been through junior high school. Ekua sells cooking utensils at Abura. Eku assists her husband in providing for the basic needs of the family. The loan will be added to her initial capital to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to build a shop.

loans.use: add to her initial capital to expand her business

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela  es una pequeña comerciante, con su propio negocio una pulpería en su casa de habitación con vario años en las ventas.
Con financiamiento que Afodenic dio, logro aumentar los niveles de ventas, teniendo mejores márgenes de ganancias, en donde decide ubicarse en su casa ya que anteriormente el negocio lo tenía en un mercado. Lo que viene a mejorar también el cuidado de su familia conformada por cinco hijos.
Lo que quiere con este nuevo financiamiento es comprar productos de consumo como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, caja de jabón,  bidón de aceite, golosinas, productos lácteos entre otros productos que circulan mas, para una mejor inversión en su negocio .
texts.en:
Adela has been a small business owner for several years and she has a small grocery store in her home.

With Afodenic’s loan (Kiva’s field partner) she was able to increase her sales resulting in greater income and decided to set up her business in her home rather than in the market where Adela was before. Her care for her family also improved as she has five children.

What Adela wants with the new loan, is to buy basic household goods like: rice, beans, sugar, a box of soap, cooking oil, candy, dairy products and other products that are sold frequently so that Adela can have a greater investment in her business.

loans.use: To buy basic household goods like: rice, beans, sugar, a box of soap, cooking oil, candy, dairy products and other products to increase her sales.

loans.name: Janet

texts.es: Janet  tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en una casa alquilada. Hace más de 4 años ella y su esposo trabajan como consultores proyectos de instalaciones de servicio de agua potable y alcantarillado de las diversas comunidades de su localidad. Incursiono en ésta actividad gracias a su cónyuge que es ingeniero de profesión, por lo que es una carta aval que garantiza que sus potenciales clientes requieran de sus servicios. Con el tiempo acondicionaron una oficina, lugar donde trabajan juntos y desde entonces ha visto grandes ventajas en sus ganancias que beneficia su economía; sin embargo desea mejorar las instalaciones de su pequeña oficina que ha implementado en su casa. Es su tercer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  además a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la ejecución de sus proyectos, asimismo desea incursionar en un nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Janet is 38 years old and she lives with her husband and their 2 children in a rented house. For the past four years, she and her husband have worked as potable water consultants and installation specialists for the various communities in their region. She started out in this business thanks to her husband who is an engineer by profession, which is an important endorsement and guarantee for potential clients needing their services. 

With time they established and office from where they can work together and since them they have seen a large improvement in their finances. They wish to make some improvements to their small home office. This is their third loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is happy to be in receipt of this financial support. She also enjoys her communal bank because she knows all of the members and they are very responsible team players.

She is grateful to all of those individuals who will contribute to the loan she requests. it will be a great support for the progress of their business. The loan that she requests will be invested in their projects and to start an additional business.

loans.use: To fund her projects.

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
Segundo forma parte del banco comunal “El Altillo” perteneciente a la ciudad de Puerto Montt. Él fabrica estructuras metálicas como por ejemplo vitrinas y exhibidores de collares y joyas en general, entre otras cosas. También arrienda un local en donde vende artículos de bazar y paquetería, ubicado en el Mall Costanera de la ciudad, desde hace 8 años. Este local lo atiende su esposa y su hija en la semana y el fin de semana lo atiende una persona contratada. 
Con este préstamo comprará mercadería para el bazar.
Su sueño es seguir creciendo en sus negocios y contratar a otra persona para que atienda el bazar.
Tiene 2 hijos universitarios que aunque trabajan, viven aún en la misma casa.
Para Segundo Fondo Esperanza ha significado una gran ayuda, para seguir con su negocio, ya que como su arriendo es caro, antes, cuando no contaba con los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza, a veces le faltaba dinero para comprar la mercadería. También le es muy grato participar en las reuniones de grupo.
Puerto Montt es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Lagos. Una de las atracciones de Puerto Montt son sus bellos paisajes verdes; sus playas poco frecuentadas; su gastronomía y especialmente la reputación de sus pescados y mariscos y sus artesanías. Es también la puerta de entrada a la Isla Grande de Chiloé, rica en tradiciones y leyendas.
texts.en:
Segundo is a member of the communal bank "El Altillo" located in the city of Puerto Montt. He is a blacksmith who makes metal projects such as display cases, jewelry boxes, jewelry items, and other products. for the past 8 years he has also had a small general store and delivery service located in the Mall Costanera in the city.  This store is managed by his wife and daughter during the week and on the weekends they have an employee to help them. This loan will be used to purchase merchandise for their general store.

His dream is to keep working at his businesses and to hire an additional person to help with the store. He has 2 children who are in university and are employed, and they both still live at home. 

For Segundo, Fondo Esperanza (Kiva Field Partner) has been a great source of support for his business. The maintenance of the business is expensive and before he had access to loans from Fondo Esperanza, he sometimes didn't have enough money to purchase merchandise. He is also very happy to attend the group meetings. 

Puerto Montt is a city in the southern region of Chile and it is located in the region of Los Lagos. some of the attractions in Puerto Montt are the beautiful green landscapes, the isolated beaches, the traditional foods (especially seafood), and the local crafts. This is also the point of entry for the island of Isla Grande de Chiloe, a location rich in traditions and legends.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his general store.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah M. is a single parent taking care of her child in Abura, Ghana. She responsibly sees to the well-being of her family.

Hannah cooks banku, a fermented corn and cassava dough mixture, and sells it served with fried fish and pepper or okra sauce. She has been in business for eight years.

Hannah’s loan will be used to buy more maize, fish and other ingredients to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to establish a cafeteria.

loans.use: To buy more maize, fish and other ingredients

loans.name: Rebeca Del Socorro

texts.es: Rebeca tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante con su familia. Su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 17 años que tiene este negocio, pues con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante, ella es una persona muy emprendedora y disfruta de su actividad. Ella sabe que tiene que ofrecer sus productos a una gran variedad de clientes, pues es de manera ambulante que realiza la venta. Es por eso que realiza este crédito para la compra de materia prima necesaria para su negocio.
texts.en:
Rebeca has a great desire to get ahead in life together with her family.  Her business is selling general merchandise.  She has been in this business for more than 17 years and, through a lot of hard work, she has managed to make progress.

Rebeca is a very enterprising person and she enjoys her work.  She knows that she has to offer her products to a wide range of customers as she makes her sales door to door.  She is requesting this loan to buy supplies she needs for her business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama S., a junior high graduate, is married and has one child. Her husband is a driver. She assists her husband in feeding, clothing and educating her children. They live in Abura.

Ama makes Fante kenkey to sell [kenkey is a fermented maize dough. The Fante people typically sell their kenkey wrapped in banana leaves]. She has been selling kenkey for three years.

Ama’s loan will be added to her working capital to increase her production of kenkey. She hopes to save the new profits from her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: For working capital to increase her production of kenkey

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi A. is married and has three children. Her husband is a carpenter, and they live in Abura. Esi uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Esi sells Fante kenkey [kenkey is a fermented maize dough. The Fante people typically sell their kenkey wrapped in banana leaves]. The loan she is requesting will be used to expand her kenkey business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to educate her children.

In the photo, Esi’s hand is holding a sample of Fante kenkey. The pot on the ground in front of her is full of the maize she uses for the production of kenkey.

loans.use: To expand her kenkey business

loans.name: Johana

texts.es: Johana tiene 22 años, vive con sus padres y hermanos en una casa propia. Hace más de 2 años vende cosméticos por medio de catálogos, ofreciéndoles a sus compañeros de estudios de la universidad donde estudia, asimismo a otras amistades que tiene. Sus productos son ofrecidos a crédito para después cobrarles por partes, pero en lo posible trata de vender sus productos cuando están de ofertas y promociones  para que se mantenga estable sus ventas. Ella se siente muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza, ya que no le perjudica su tiempo de estudios y a la vez poder solventar sus propios gastos. Ahora su meta se ha propuesto la de incrementar aún más la mercadería que tiene y poder vender más. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece además a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá comprar más mercadería en productos de belleza.
texts.en:
Johana, 22, lives with her parents and siblings in their own house.  For over two years she has sold cosmetics via catalogue sales to her fellow university students where she’s enrolled as well as to other acquaintances she has.  She offers her products on credit and collects partial payments.  For the most part, however, she strives to offer her products when they are on sale or special promotion so that her sales will remain constant.  She feels very happy with the work she does since it does not interfere with her studies and provides for her personal expenses.

Her goal now is to increase her stock merchandise still more in order to sell more.  This is her first loan with MFP and she is happy to know that she can count on financial assistance.  Besides, she enjoys participating in her communal bank because all the members are people she knows who are responsible and mutually supportive.

She is grateful to all the people who will fund the loan she is requesting because it will be very useful for her business’ progress.  She will use the requested loan to buy more beauty products.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Kuuwa

texts.en:
Kuuwa A. is married and has four children. Kuuwa bakes bread at Abura for sale and distribution. She has been in this business for four years. Her husband is a surveyor. Kuuwa uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of the home.

 Kuuwa will use the loan to purchase more ingredients to bake bread for distribution. She anticipates reinvesting the new profits.

loans.use: purchase more ingredients to bake bread for distribution

loans.name: Rosa Noelia

texts.es: Rosa Noelia tiene 23 años, ella vive en el barrio Carlos Núñez desde hace más de 3 años, pues su principal fuente de trabajo es la venta de mercadería en general. A pesar de ser una joven en este negocio ha tenido la experiencia de compartir con sus clientes para saber lo que ellos solicitan pues siempre está pendiente de de generar ingresos para su hogar. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de cosméticos, calzado, ropa,  sabanas entre otras.
texts.en: Rosa Noelia, 23, has lived in the Carlos Núñez neighborhood for over three years. Her main source of income is general merchandise sales.  Despite being a young in this business she’s had the experience of relating to her customers and knowing what they are looking for because she is always watchful in order to generate income for her home.  The loan she is requesting is to buy cosmetics, footwear, clothing and sheets, among others.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, footwear, clothes and sheets, among others.

loans.name: Edwin Bladimir

texts.es:
El Señor Edwin Bladimir S. G. tiene 20 años de edad y vive en la casa de sus padres  en la comunidad de San Andres de esta ciudad de Tarija. Edwin no es casado y no tiene hijos. Edwin  se dedica desde hace mas de 3 años a la producción agrícola sacando al mercado productos como ser papa, zanahoria, arveja, etc. Lo cuales vende en el mercado campesino. Edwin quiere tener mejores ingresos para salir adelante, pero el nos cuenta que tiene la necesidad de comprar semillas de papa, abonos, remedios, es por eso que el crédito será destinado para la compra de dichos productos, para de ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos.    
                                                                                                                                                                                                  
Edwin nos cuenta que quiere mejorar las condiciones de vida que tiene, por eso nos dice que el próximo crédito que solicite será para mejorar las condiciones de su casa donde vive.
texts.en:
Mr. Edwin Bladimir Sánchez G., 20, lives in his parents’ house in the city of Tarija’s San Andrés community.  Edwin is unmarried and has no children.

For over three years Edwin has been farming producing such products as potatoes, carrots, peas, etc. to market at the local farmers’ market.
Edwin wants to have better income in order to get ahead but he tells us that he needs to buy potato seed, manure and plant treatments so the loan will be destined to buy said products thus increasing his income.

Edwin tells us that he wants to improve his living conditions so mentions that the next loan he requests will be for home improvements in the house he lives in.

loans.use: To buy seeds.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba A. is married and has one child. She sells rice and 'Fante kenkey' (balls of fermented maize dough) at Abura. Her husband is a mason. Aba uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

 Aba will use the loan to purchase more maize to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to reinvest back into her business.

In her hand is a 'Fante kenkey' ball. The bowl close to her is full of corn dough.

loans.use: purchase more maize to expand her business

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba E. sells jewelry at Abura by moving from one area to another. She is a widow taking care of eight dependents. Araba has been in this trade for two years. She is responsible for the well-being of her family. Her loan will be used to expand her jewelry business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: expand her jewelry business

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa tiene 55 años vive en compañía D. sus 3 hijas en su casa propia. DesD. hace 10 años tiene su tienda D. comestibles, actividad que le ayudo en su economía y a mantener sus otros trabajos, como la agrícola y ganadera. Trabaja todos los días en la atención a los clientes, en ocasiones sus hijos la ayudan en el negocio, y cada semana se abastece D. nueva mercadería para tener siempre su tienda repleta D. mercancía. Con el  en el paso D. los años le ha permitido crecer un poco más en su economía además que disfruta día a día D. realizar esta actividad comercial que se complementa a las demás actividades que ella realiza: como es la agricultura y crianza D. animales. A futuro desea seguir desarrollando esta actividad hasta tener una tienda más granD. y mejor implementada. Es su crédito numero 14 con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. mercadería para su tienda y con otra parte en un nuevo negocio que ha empezado que es  la venta D. medicinas naturales.
texts.en:
Luisa, 55, lives with her three daughters in her own house.  For the last ten years she has had a grocery store, an activity that has helped her economy and her other jobs: farming and cattle raising.

She works every day taking care of customers.  Sometimes her children help her in the store.  Every week she stocks up on new merchandise so that the store will always be full of goods.  As the years have passed her economic situation has improved thanks to it and she enjoys this commercial activity which complements her other occupations, like farming and raising animals.

In the future she’d like to continue developing in this business reaching the point of having a larger, better stocked store.  This is her 14th loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial help and she has always been responsible with her repayments.  Besides, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all the members are responsible, very mutually supportive people.

She thanks those people who will fund the loan she is asking for which will be very useful for her store’s progress.

She plans to use this loan to buy merchandise for her store and part of it for a new business she’s started: the sale of natural remedies.

loans.use: To stock her store with new products and to buy natural products.

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen lives in Mian Channu, a small city located in Punjab province, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has lived there with her family in an area called Kothi Nan Singh in a single-room brick house for over 12 years. Perveen is a housewife, preferring to stay at home and do her household tasks. She has given birth to two sons and a daughter. All of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education.  

Her husband's name is M. F. A. and he is involved in a construction supply sales business. He operates a shop in the market where he sells construction supplies such as sand, bricks, cement etc. to his customers and earns income for the family. He has been in this business for over 8 years and manages to have a good number of clients. 

Perveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to further improve her husband’s business. With the loan, he will purchase construction supplies in bulk quantities to fill larger orders on time and to earn good income. Perveen is hopeful that an investment will bring more profit for her husband’s business and she will be able to provide better educational and living facilities to her children. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for construction supplies sales business

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua K. operates a food stall where people come to eat at Abura. She cooks foods such as fufu (mashed cassava), banku (maize porridge), yams and others. She is married and has five dependents. Ekua has been in the cooking business for three years. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be added to her working capital to increase the number of foods cooked for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her dependents.

Ekua is stirring one of the soups (palm-nut soup) she plans to serve her customers.

loans.use: add to her working capital to increase the number of foods cooked for sale

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama B. sells fresh and smoked fish at Abura. Ama has received junior high education. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a mason. She assists her husband in feeding the household. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a plot of land.

At the time of the visit, Ama was about to clean the fish for smoking.

loans.use: buy more fish to expand her business

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. sells cassava and is a stone cracker in Abura. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a mason. Ama has been in this business for four years. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. 

Her loan will be used to invest in the stone-cracking business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to invest in the stone-cracking business

loans.name: Brenda Macarena

texts.es: Brenda Macarena tiene 47 años, su actividad es la venta de repostería y piñatas. Hace más de 19 años que tiene este negocio, sus inicio se dan como una fuente de ingresos necesarias para su hogar, es una persona muy responsable inicio por su Mama quien le enseño este medio de vida la mayoría de sus clientes siempre están al pendiente de la elaboración de sus deliciosas  repostería y piñatas. A pesar de la gran competencia que tiene no deja de vender sus productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de mantequilla, queso, huevo, harina, colorante y materiales para la elaboración de sus piñatas.
texts.en:
Brenda Macarena is 47. She sells pastries and piñatas. She has had this business for over 19 years and it provides the necessary source of income for her home. She is a very responsible person. She started her business because of her mother, who taught her this way of life.
The majority of her customers are always looking forward to her piñatas and delicious pastries. Despite the great competition, she is still selling. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of butter, cheese, eggs, flour, colouring, and materials for making piñatas.

loans.use: working capital; the purchase of butter, cheese, eggs, flour, colouring, and materials for making piñatas.

loans.name: Rasheedan's Group

texts.en:
Rasheedan lives in Mian Channu, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has lived there in a single-room brick house with her family for over 12 years.
 
She is 42 years old. She is married to M. A. and has three sons. Two of them are getting an education while her eldest son has a business of selling animals. He buys animals from the animal market, raises them up and sells them to his customers to earn an income. He started this business six years ago and in this short time period, he has obtained a good number of customers. 

Her husband operates a tea stall in the market, where he sells different flavor teas like green, black and milk tea. He is known among his clients for the good taste of his tea. 

Rasheedan is a housewife; she stays at home and does her household works. She is a very good administrator and manages her household tasks very well. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s animal selling business. With the loan, he will buy animals (goats) and raise them up to sell for a good profit. 

Rasheedan is hopeful that her son will successfully be able to improve his business condition after investing money into it. She is a new loan applicant at Asasah.

loans.use: To buy animals (goats) for an animal-sales business

loans.name: María Doralba

texts.es:
Al separarse de su esposo y quedando como madre cabeza de hogar, María Doralba G. O. se vio en la necesidad de crear su propio negocio con el fin obtener los recursos necesarios para su sustento y el de su familia. Aprovechando los conocimientos que por hobbie había adquierido en las técnicas de beleza, inició con su peluquería que según esta emprendedora ha sido su tabla de salvación. 

Con el propósito de mejorar la imagen de su negocio y lograr una mejor exhibición de los productos de belleza que también vende, María Doralba, necesita de un préstamo para adquirir una vitrina y comprar aún más productos para ofrecerle a sus clientes. 

En el futuro esta luchadora, espera tener su local independiente de su casa, pues actualmente se vio obligada a realizar la adaptación en su casa para operar su negocio.
texts.en:
After separating from her husband, María Doralba G. O. became the head of her household and found it necessary to create her own business in order to obtain the necessary income to sustain herself and her family.  Taking advantage of knowledge of beauty techniques she had gained from a hobby, she started the hairstyling business which she says has been her lifesaver.

With the goal of improving her business' image and better displaying the beauty products that she sells, Maria Doralba needs this loan to buy a display case and more products to offer her clients.

In the future, this fighter hopes to have a location independent of her home, since she currently has to use her home in order to operate her business.

loans.use: the purchase of a display case and beauty products

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina tiene 37 años, vive al lado de sus 2 hijas en una casa arrendada. Hace más de 3 años que tiene su negocio, que es un restaurante, donde ella misma prepara los alimentos. Asimismo sus hijos la apoyan en la atención y servicio a los clientes, ofreciendo desayunos y almuerzos. Le agrada su trabajo, ya que siempre dispone de la comida de cada día además que le gusta cocinar aunque reconoce en varias oportunidades que es muy sacrificado y que requiere de mucho tiempo. Su negocio ha crecido con el tiempo y esta muy feliz por lo que desea continuar adelante en el crecimiento de su restaurante. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes no perecibles para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Marina is 37 and lives with her 2 daughters in a rented home. She has had her restaurant for over three years, where she is the chef. Her children help her to serve the customers. They offer breakfast and lunch. She enjoys her work, since she always has food for the day. Furthermore, she likes cooking even though she recognizes that at times it takes great sacrifice and requires a lot of time.

Her business has grown with time, and she is very happy because she wants to continue to succeed and expand her restaurant. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has financial support. She is also happy to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are people whom she knows, who are responsible and very supportive. She thanks those of you who will support this loan, as it will be very useful for her business. 

With the requested loan, she will invest in the purchase of non-perishable ingredients for making her food.

loans.use: to purchase non-perishable products.

loans.name: Obdulia

texts.es: Obdulia tiene  40 años, vive con su  esposo y 4 hijos en su propia casa. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de dulces y golosinas en la puerta de una escuela primaria cercana a su casa donde especialmente atiende en tiempo de recreo y salida. En época de vacaciones aprovecha las temporadas de clases vacacionales que dan en diversos centros educativos de su localidad, de esa manera tiene más ventas. Reparte adecuadamente su tiempo en las labores de su casa y la atención de su negocio  que  cada día  realiza,  valiéndose  de su pequeña carreta donde traslada sus dulces de su casa a la escuela. Durante este tiempo de trabajo ha visto las ventajas de su negocio, por lo que se ha decidido en mejorar su establecimiento con mayor cantidad  de golosinas. Es su segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica.
